original: sems kyi dbang gis lus de dang de ltar gnas pa ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang gis lus de dang de ltar gnas pa ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed yin no //
translated: The body is the basis of the action of going, because the body is situated in different places through the power of thought.

original: gzhan dag na ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed 'gro ba yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed 'gro ba yin par 'dod de /
translated: Other masters maintain that bodily informative action is movement.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: lus g-yo ba nas lus kyi las yin gyi mi g-yo ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus g-yo ba nas lus kyi las yin gyi mi g-yo ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the body is in motion when it is in action, but not when it is not in action.

original: de la 'gro ba yin par smra ba rnams la dbyibs su smra bas lan btab pa /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba yin par smra ba rnams la dbyibs su smra bas lan btab pa /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika replies to the SautrƒÅntika who maintains that going is movement:

original: 'gro ba ma yin gang gi phyir //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma yin gang gi phyir //

original: 'dus byas skad cig /'dus byas thams cad ni bdag nyid thob pa las phan chad du mi gnas te /
analyzed: 'dus byas skad cig /'dus byas thams cad ni bdag nyid thob pa las phan chad du mi gnas te /

original: gang du skyes pa de nyid du 'jig pa de la ni yul gzhan du 'pho bar mi rigs pas /
analyzed: gang du skyes pa de nyid du 'jig pa de la ni yul gzhan du 'pho bar mi rigs pas /

original: de bas na lus kyi rnam par rig byed ni 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na lus kyi rnam par rig byed ni 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore bodily informative action is not going.

original: gal te thams cad skad cig ma nyid du grub par gyur na ni de bzhin du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad skad cig ma nyid du grub par gyur na ni de bzhin du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were established that all things are momentary, then your thesis would be established.

original: ma grub pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not established.

original: de ni grub pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni grub pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This is to be understood as the establishment.

original: gang las she na /üîΩ'dus byas la ni rgyu med par //
analyzed: gang las she na / 'dus byas la ni rgyu med par //
translated: From what?

original: 'jig phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig phyir ro //
translated: Because of the destruction of the conditioned without a cause.

original: 'jig pa ni bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba thams cad ni rgyu med par 'jig go //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba thams cad ni rgyu med par 'jig go //
translated: Destruction is not an action, therefore all arising is without a cause.

original: rgyu med par 'jig pa gang yin pa de gal te dngos po byung ba tsam lam yin na ni bye brag med pa'i phyir phyis kyang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: rgyu med par 'jig pa gang yin pa de gal te dngos po byung ba tsam lam yin na ni bye brag med pa'i phyir phyis kyang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If destruction without a cause were to occur only when the entity has arisen, then it would not occur later, because there would be no difference.

original: de ni mthong ba ste de dag ni skad cig ma nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba ste de dag ni skad cig ma nyid du grub bo //
translated: But it is seen that it occurs later, therefore it is established that entities are momentary.

original: dngos po rnams rgyu med par 'jig go zhes bya ba 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rgyu med par 'jig go zhes bya ba 'di gang las she na /
translated: From what is it known that entities are destroyed without a cause?

original: bshad zin to //
analyzed: bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained.

original: ji skad du bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad ce na /
translated: How has it been explained?

original: 'jig pa ni bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause destruction is not an action.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang / @158a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang / @158a * //
translated: Moreover:

original: rgyu med pa las 'ga' mi 'byung //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las 'ga' mi 'byung //
translated: Nothing arises without a cause.

original: gal te 'jig pa las rgyu can zhig tu gyur na ni skye ba bzhin du 'ga' yang rgyu med par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa las rgyu can zhig tu gyur na ni skye ba bzhin du 'ga' yang rgyu med par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If destruction were caused, then like arising, it would not be causeless.

original: blo dang sgra dang me lce dag gi skad cig ma rnams la rgyu med par 'jig pa yang mthong bas 'di ni rgyu la ltos pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: blo dang sgra dang me lce dag gi skad cig ma rnams la rgyu med par 'jig pa yang mthong bas 'di ni rgyu la ltos pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But since we see that the instants of thought, sound, and flame are destroyed without a cause, this destruction does not depend on a cause.

original: gal te yang shing la sogs pa me dang 'brel pa'i rgyu can zhig tu 'jig par 'gyur na ni cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang shing la sogs pa me dang 'brel pa'i rgyu can zhig tu 'jig par 'gyur na ni cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the destruction of a log, etc., were caused by contact with fire, what would follow?

original: chos pa las skye ba bzhin du 'jig pa la yang 'jig pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos pa las skye ba bzhin du 'jig pa la yang 'jig pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as arising is of an arising, so destruction would be of a destructing.

original: rgyu yang 'jig pa por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'jig pa por 'gyur ro //
translated: And the cause would be the destroyer.

original: gal te shing la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i me dang 'brel pa'i rgyu can du 'jig par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te shing la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i me dang 'brel pa'i rgyu can du 'jig par gyur na ni /
translated: If the destruction of the log, etc., were caused by contact with fire,üîΩthen the cause of burning, the fire, would be the destroyer of the log, etc., just as the cause of arising is the producer of the born.

original: de lta yin na ni tshos pa las skyes pa'i tshos pa dang / cher tshos pa dang / ches cher tshos pa dag la rgyu nyid 'jig pa por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni tshos pa las skyes pa'i tshos pa dang / cher tshos pa dang / ches cher tshos pa dag la rgyu nyid 'jig pa por 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the cause of burning would be the destroyer of the burned, the very burned, and the overburned.

original: 'di lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta zhe na /
translated: For example,

original: me dang 'brel gang ches tshos pa las skyes pa byung ba rnams de nyid las sam de dang 'dra ba las /
analyzed: me dang 'brel gang ches tshos pa las skyes pa byung ba rnams de nyid las sam de dang 'dra ba las /

original: yang tshos pa dang / cher tshos pa dang / ches cher tshos pa byung na de dag 'jig pas rgyu nyid de dag gi 'jig pa po 'am rgyu bye brag med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: yang tshos pa dang / cher tshos pa dang / ches cher tshos pa byung na de dag 'jig pas rgyu nyid de dag gi 'jig pa po 'am rgyu bye brag med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If what is cooked, what is very much cooked, and what is very much more cooked are produced, then they are destroyed. Therefore, the cause itself would be the destroyer of them, or there would be no difference in the cause.

original: gang nyid las sam gang dang 'dra ba las skyes pa ni de nyid las sam de dang 'dra ba las med par 'gyur bar rig pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gang nyid las sam gang dang 'dra ba las skyes pa ni de nyid las sam de dang 'dra ba las med par 'gyur bar rig pa ma yin pas /
translated: But it is not known that what is produced from that or from what is similar to that is not produced from that or from what is similar to that.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa la rgyu med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa la rgyu med do //
translated: Therefore, the destruction of things has no cause.

original: bdag nyid 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir 'jig na ni byung ba tsam nyid du 'jig pas 'di dag skad cig mar 'jig par grub bo //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir 'jig na ni byung ba tsam nyid du 'jig pas 'di dag skad cig mar 'jig par grub bo //
translated: If it is destroyed because it is destroyed by itself, it is destroyed merely by arising. Therefore, it is established that these are momentary.

original: skad cig mar zhig pa'i phyir 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: skad cig mar zhig pa'i phyir 'gro ba med do //
translated: Because they are destroyed in a moment, they do not go.

original: rtsva med bzhin du yul gzhan du bar chad med par 'byung ba la 'gro ba yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed do //
analyzed: rtsva med bzhin du yul gzhan du bar chad med par 'byung ba la 'gro ba yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed do //
translated: and that it moves without obstruction from one place to another, like a firebrand whirled in the air.

original: 'gro ba med na lus kyi rnam par rig byed ni dbyibs yin par grub bo //
analyzed: 'gro ba med na lus kyi rnam par rig byed ni dbyibs yin par grub bo //
translated: If there is no movement, then bodily intimation is established as shape.

original: yang de skad du smra ba dag dbyibs rdzas su smra ba rnams la dpes ston pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: yang de skad du smra ba dag dbyibs rdzas su smra ba rnams la dpes ston pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, who maintain that shape is a real substance, are addressed:

analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa las rigs gzhan pa'i dbyibs rdzas ni yod pa ma yin no //

original: gal te yod na ni de /
analyzed: gal te yod na ni de /

original: gnyis gzung 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyis gzung 'gyur /

original: mig gis mthong na yang ring po'o zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mig gis mthong na yang ring po'o zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur la /

analyzed: lus kyi dbang pos reg na yang ring po'o zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni dbang po nyid kyis 'dzin par @158b 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore, it would be apprehended by the sense faculties themselves,

original: gzugs kyi skye mched la ni gnyis kyis 'dzin pa med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched la ni gnyis kyis 'dzin pa med de /
translated: but the form base is not apprehended by two sense faculties.

original: de bas na dbyibs ni rdzas nyid du med do //
analyzed: de bas na dbyibs ni rdzas nyid du med do //
translated: Therefore shape does not exist as a real substance.

original: gang yang chung zad thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs yod pa de ni gdon ma zos par rdul phra mo dag la yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /üîΩring bo la sogs pa yi dbyibs //
analyzed: gang yang chung zad thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs yod pa de ni gdon ma zos par rdul phra mo dag la yod par 'gyur ba zhig na / ring bo la sogs pa yi dbyibs //
translated: Whatever form exists as a slight obstruction must exist in the subtle particles.

original: de rdul la med /
analyzed: de rdul la med /
translated: Length, etc., are not in the subtle particles.

original: de bas na mang po de ltar gnas pa nyid la ring po la sogs par gdags so //
analyzed: de bas na mang po de ltar gnas pa nyid la ring po la sogs par gdags so //
translated: Therefore, length, etc., are imputed to the mere arrangement of many subtle particles.

original: da ni lus kyi 'gro ba dang dbyibs kyang bsal na /
analyzed: da ni lus kyi 'gro ba dang dbyibs kyang bsal na /
translated: Now, if the movement and shape of the body are refuted,

analyzed: de la dpe ston pa khyed rnams ci la lus kyi rnam par rig byed du 'dogs she na /
translated: what do you, the proponents of examples, impute as bodily informative form?

original: de dag ni dbyibs nyid la lus kyi rnam par rig byed du 'dogs par byed la rdzas su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dbyibs nyid la lus kyi rnam par rig byed du 'dogs par byed la rdzas su ni ma yin no //
translated: They impute bodily informative form to shape itself, not to substance.

analyzed: der 'dogs pa na ji ltar lus kyi las su 'dogs par byed ce na /

analyzed: lus la brten pa'i las ni lus kyi las te /

analyzed: de dang der lus 'jug par byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is intention that causes the body to engage in this or that action.

analyzed: de bzhin du ngag dang yid kyi las dag la yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o // gzhung pa dag na re dbyibs ni rdzas nyid yin la /
translated: The same applies to the actions of speech and mind.üîΩThe VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that shape is a real entity.

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed ni dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can no zhes brjod do //üîΩngag gi rnam rig ngag gi sgra //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed ni dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can no zhes brjod do // ngag gi rnam rig ngag gi sgra //

analyzed: ngag gi rang bzhin gyi sgra gang yin pa de nyid dag gi rnam par rig byed yin no //

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni sngar bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni sngar bshad pa nyid do //
translated: Nonindicative form has already been explained.

original: dpes ston pa dag na re /
analyzed: dpes ston pa dag na re /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say:

original: de yang mi bya bar khas 'ches pa tsam yin pa'i phyir rdzas nyid du med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yang mi bya bar khas 'ches pa tsam yin pa'i phyir rdzas nyid du med do zhes zer ro //
translated: It does not exist as a real entity because it is merely a promise not to do something.

original: gzhung pa dag na re yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhung pa dag na re yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say: It does exist.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know?üîΩThe s≈´tras state that there are three types of form,

original: rnam gsum dri med gzugs gsungs dang // 'phel dang ma byas la sogs las //
analyzed: rnam gsum dri med gzugs gsungs dang // 'phel dang ma byas la sogs las //
translated: that which is uncontaminated, that which increases and that which is not created.

original: mdo las gzugs rnam pa gsum gsungs pa la /
analyzed: mdo las gzugs rnam pa gsum gsungs pa la /
translated: The s≈´tras state that there are three types of form:

original: bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyang yod /
analyzed: bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyang yod /
translated: There is form that is demonstrable and impeded.

original: bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyang yod /
analyzed: bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyang yod /
translated: There is form that is not demonstrable but impeded.üîΩThere is form that is neither demonstrable nor impeded.

analyzed: bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa'i gzugs kyang yod ces bya ba gnas gsum dag gi gzugs kho nar gzugs bsdu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus form is subsumed in these three categories.

original: zag pa med pa'i gzugs kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i gzugs kyang gsungs te /
translated: Also, uncontaminated form is mentioned.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /üîΩ'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i gzugs gang la rjes su chags pa'am khong khrob mi skye ba nas rnam par shes pa gang @159a * //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i gzugs gang la rjes su chags pa'am khong khrob mi skye ba nas rnam par shes pa gang @159a * //

analyzed: la mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni zag pa med pa'i chos zhes bya'o zhes pa la /
translated: Any form of the past, future, or present with regard to which the passions of desire or hatred do not arise, up to any consciousness with regard to which the passions of desire or hatred do not arise, this is called an uncontaminated dharma.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ma gtogs par ni bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'i gzugs kyang med la zag pa med pa yang med do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ma gtogs par ni bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'i gzugs kyang med la zag pa med pa yang med do //
translated: Except for nonindicative form, there is no form that is not demonstrable and impeded, nor is there any uncontaminated form.

original: 'phel bar yang gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phel bar yang gsungs te /
translated: It is also said to increase.üîΩThe S≈´tra on the Seven Kinds of Good Actions That Generate

original: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bdun gyi mdo las /
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bdun gyi mdo las /
translated: Wealth states:üîΩMerit will always increase and arise uninterruptedly.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsod nams mngon par 'phel zhing skye bar 'gyur ba nyid do zhes gsungs pa'ang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa las gzhan pa yid kyis ni bsod nams mngon par 'phel bar rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsod nams mngon par 'phel zhing skye bar 'gyur ba nyid do zhes gsungs pa'ang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa las gzhan pa yid kyis ni bsod nams mngon par 'phel bar rung ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not tenable that merit increases through the mental faculty alone, apart from nonindicative form.

original: bdag gis ma byas la gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i las kyi lam kun nas ldang ba yang mthong ste /
analyzed: bdag gis ma byas la gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i las kyi lam kun nas ldang ba yang mthong ste /
translated: We see that the motivating factors of actions are committed by one person but instigated by another.

original: de yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med par mi rigs so //
translated: And it is illogical that they would not be nonindicative form.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said:

original: dge slong dag chos ni phyi'i skye mched de /
analyzed: dge slong dag chos ni phyi'i skye mched de /
translated: Monks, phenomena are external bases.üîΩThey are not subsumed by the eleven bases, they are undemonstrable, and they are unimpeded.

original: skye mched bcu gcig gis ma bsdus pa bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'o zhes gsungs kyi gzugs can ma yin pa'o zhes ni ma gsungs pas /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gcig gis ma bsdus pa bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'o zhes gsungs kyi gzugs can ma yin pa'o zhes ni ma gsungs pas /

original: gal te chos kyi skye mched kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i gzugs ma gzigs na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi skye mched kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i gzugs ma gzigs na /
translated: If you do not see form that is included in the sense base of mental objects,

original: de la dgos pa ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de la dgos pa ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: what purpose would that serve?

original: snyoms par zhugs pa la ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba med pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs par 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad du yang mi 'gyur bas de bas na rnam par rig byed ma yin pas yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa la ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba med pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs par 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad du yang mi 'gyur bas de bas na rnam par rig byed ma yin pas yod pa nyid do //
translated: And if you do not see noninformative form, then the eightfold noble path would not exist in meditative attainment, because there would be no speech, no action, and no livelihood. Therefore noninformative form does exist.

original: gal te yod la de yang 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa'o zhes bshad na /
analyzed: gal te yod la de yang 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa'o zhes bshad na /
translated: If it exists, and if you say that it is derived from the primary elements,

original: de ci rnam par rig byed kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams nyid rgyur byas nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skye'am zhe na /
analyzed: de ci rnam par rig byed kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams nyid rgyur byas nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skye'am zhe na /
translated: then is noninformative form derived from the very same primary elements that are the cause of informative form?

original: smras pa / ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin te /
translated: We reply: No.

original: tshogs pa de nyid las 'bras bu phra ma dang / 'bras bu rags pa de gnyi ga 'byung bar ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshogs pa de nyid las 'bras bu phra ma dang / 'bras bu rags pa de gnyi ga 'byung bar ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for both a subtle and a gross effect to arise from that very same assemblage.

original: ji rnam par rig byed gang gi dus pa nyid yin pa de'i dus pa nyid kyis 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas ba min nam zhe na /
analyzed: ji rnam par rig byed gang gi dus pa nyid yin pa de'i dus pa nyid kyis 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas ba min nam zhe na /
translated: Is not the time of the great elements that are the cause of the form that is indicative of sentient beings the same time as the form that is indicative of sentient beings?

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad ni phal cher de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad ni phal cher de bzhin no //
translated: All form that is derived is generally like that.

original: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa cung zad cig ni 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa yin te /
analyzed: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa cung zad cig ni 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa yin te /
translated: But some present and future form is derived from past great elements.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'dod gtogs rnam rig min skad cig / phyin chad 'das pa'i 'byung las skyes //
analyzed: 'dod gtogs rnam rig min skad cig / phyin chad 'das pa'i 'byung las skyes //
translated: Nonindicative form in the desire realm arises from past elements after the first moment.

original: @159b 'dod gtogs rnam rig min zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: @159b 'dod gtogs rnam rig min zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: Nonindicative form in the desire realm is form in the desire realm.

original: skad cig phyin chad ces bya ba ni skad cig ma dang po las dus phyi ma'o //
analyzed: skad cig phyin chad ces bya ba ni skad cig ma dang po las dus phyi ma'o //
translated: After the first moment means after the first moment.

original: 'das pa'i 'byung las skye zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas nas skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'byung las skye zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas nas skye ba ste /
translated: Arises from past elements means it arises derived from past great elements.

original: de dag ni 'di'i gzhi'i don du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di'i gzhi'i don du 'gyur la /
translated: Those are the basis of this.

original: da ltar byung ba'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rten gyi don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rten gyi don du 'gyur ro //
translated: The great elements that exist now are the basis.

original: rab tu 'jug pa dang / rjes su 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa dang / rjes su 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin te /
translated: They are the cause of projection and of the following of the action, respectively.

original: 'khor los la 'dril ba'i lag pas phug pa dang / sa'i phyogs bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khor los la 'dril ba'i lag pas phug pa dang / sa'i phyogs bzhin no //
translated: For example, the hand of a potter is the cause of projection of the pot, and the clay is the cause of the following of the pot.

original: yang sa gang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las la gang ba'i 'byung ba rnams rgyur byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang sa gang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las la gang ba'i 'byung ba rnams rgyur byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: In what realm are the great elements that are the cause of the body and speech of a certain realm?

original: zag bcas lus dang ngag gi las //üîΩrang gi 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'o //
analyzed: zag bcas lus dang ngag gi las // rang gi 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'o //
translated: The body and speech of the realm of desireüîΩare made of the great elements of that realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus dang ngag gi las ni 'dod pa spyod pa nyid kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus dang ngag gi las ni 'dod pa spyod pa nyid kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa yin la /
translated: The body and speech of the realm of desire are made of the great elements of the realm of desire.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar du yang de'i sa pa nyid rnams rgyur byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar du yang de'i sa pa nyid rnams rgyur byas pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, up to the body and speech of the fourth meditation are made of the great elements of the fourth meditation.

original: zag med gang du skyes pa yin /
analyzed: zag med gang du skyes pa yin /
translated: The pure ones are made of the great elements of the place where one is born.

original: zag pa med pa'i lus dang ngag gi las de ni sa gang du skyes par skyed par byed pas de ni sa de pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lus dang ngag gi las de ni sa gang du skyes par skyed par byed pas de ni sa de pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: That uncontaminated action of body and speech is generated in whatever realm it is born, and it should be understood that it is derived from the great elements of that realm.

original: khams su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ba dang / zag pa med pa rnams la 'byung ba dag med pa'i phyir ba dang / de'i stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ba dang / zag pa med pa rnams la 'byung ba dag med pa'i phyir ba dang / de'i stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not belong to the realms, because the uncontaminated states have no elements, and because it arises by the power of those elements.

original: de la rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i las la /
analyzed: de la rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i las la /
translated: Regarding action called informative and noninformative,

original: rnam rig ma yin rgyu mthun 'byung //
analyzed: rnam rig ma yin rgyu mthun 'byung //
translated: noninformative arises from natural outflow.

original: ma zin sems can zhes bya bar //
analyzed: ma zin sems can zhes bya bar //
translated: It is unappropriated and is called sentient.

original: rig par bya'o //üîΩgzhan yang / rgyu mthun zin pa'i 'byung las skyes //
analyzed: rig par bya'o // gzhan yang / rgyu mthun zin pa'i 'byung las skyes //
translated: It should be understood thatüîΩnoninformative action arises from natural outflow and from appropriated great elements.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams nyid rgyur byas nas skye ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams nyid rgyur byas nas skye ste /
translated: Noninformative action arises from natural outflow and from appropriated great elements as its cause.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i sa pa rnams ni de lta'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i sa pa rnams ni de lta'o //
translated: Those on the levels of nonequipoise are like that.

original: ting 'dzin las skyes rgyu las 'byung //
analyzed: ting 'dzin las skyes rgyu las 'byung //
translated: It arises from concentration and from the primary elements that are its cause.

original: ma zin 'byung ba gcig las skyes //
analyzed: ma zin 'byung ba gcig las skyes //
translated: It arises from the primary elements that are not grasped, that are not of the same nature.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni ting nge 'dzin skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las byung ba dang / ma zin pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas nas skye ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni ting nge 'dzin skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las byung ba dang / ma zin pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas nas skye ste /
translated: The unmanifest action which is the restraint co-arisen with meditation and the uncontaminated restraint arises from the primary elements that are the cause of the arising and development of concentration, and from the primary elements that are not grasped and are not of the same nature.

original: 'byung ba gang @160a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba gang @160a * //
translated: From what primary elements does the restraint of the absorptions arise?

original: dag rgyur byas nas srog gcod pa spangs pa skye ba de dag nyid las tshig kyal pa spangs pa'i bar du skye'o //
analyzed: dag rgyur byas nas srog gcod pa spangs pa skye ba de dag nyid las tshig kyal pa spangs pa'i bar du skye'o //
translated: From the primary elements that are the cause of the arising of the abandonment of taking life, up to the primary elements that are the cause of the arising of the abandonment of idle speech.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems bzhin du 'byung ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩso sor thar ba'i sdom pa ni 'byung ba chen po gzhan dang gzhan dag rgyur byas nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bdun skye'o //
analyzed: sems bzhin du 'byung ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro // so sor thar ba'i sdom pa ni 'byung ba chen po gzhan dang gzhan dag rgyur byas nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bdun skye'o //
translated: Because the primary elements are different from the mind.üîΩThe restraint of the code arises from the primary elements that are the cause of the arising of the seven unmanifest actions.

original: rnam par rig byed ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Manifest action arises from the primary elements that are the cause of the arising of the primary elements that are its cause.

original: lus kyis ni zin pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis ni zin pa'o //
translated: The body is the support of the action.

original: de ltar las rnam pa gnyis dang / rnam pa gsum dang / rnam pa lngar bshad bde la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar las rnam pa gnyis dang / rnam pa gsum dang / rnam pa lngar bshad bde la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus action is of two types, of three types, and of five types. Noninformative action is of two types: wholesome and unwholesome.

original: lung bstan min rnam rig min med //
analyzed: lung bstan min rnam rig min med //
translated: Noninformative action does not exist in the realm of immateriality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ni stobs chung bas de'i phyir gang 'gag kyang de'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i las stobs dang ldan pa 'phen par mi nus so //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ni stobs chung bas de'i phyir gang 'gag kyang de'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i las stobs dang ldan pa 'phen par mi nus so //
translated: Because the thought of the realm of immateriality is weak, and thus incapable of projecting an action that would conform to it and continue to exist after its cessation.

original: gzhan ni rnam gsum /
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam gsum /
translated: The other is of three types.

original: las gzhan ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: las gzhan ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang gsum mo //
translated: The other action, i.e., the action of informative action and intention, is of three types: wholesome, unwholesome, nondefined.

original: gzhan gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gzhan gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the other?

original: rnam par rig byed dang sems pa'o //üîΩmi dge ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang sems pa'o // mi dge ni /
translated: Informative action and intention.üîΩUnwholesome action exists only in the realm of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i mi dge ba'i las ni 'dod pa'i khams 'ba' zhig na yod kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i mi dge ba'i las ni 'dod pa'i khams 'ba' zhig na yod kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Unwholesome action exists only in the realm of desire, not elsewhere.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa sbangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa sbangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the roots of non-good and shamelessness and lack of conscience are abandoned there.

original: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni ma bkag pa'i phyir thams cad na yod do //
analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni ma bkag pa'i phyir thams cad na yod do //
translated: Good and non-defined are present everywhere, because they are not prohibited.

original: de la gzugs na'ang rnam rig min //
analyzed: de la gzugs na'ang rnam rig min //
translated: In the realm of form, there is also non-informative.

original: yang gi sgras ni 'dod pa na yang yod do //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni 'dod pa na yang yod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is also in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs med pa dag ni 'byung ba med pa'i phyir med de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag ni 'byung ba med pa'i phyir med de /
translated: It is not in the formless realm, because there is no primary element there.

original: gang du lus dang ngag 'jug pa der lus dang ngag gi gi sdom pa yin no //üîΩrnam rig spyod dang bcas pa yi //üîΩsa gnyis nyid na ste /
analyzed: gang du lus dang ngag 'jug pa der lus dang ngag gi gi sdom pa yin no // rnam rig spyod dang bcas pa yi // sa gnyis nyid na ste /
translated: Where there is activity of body and speech, there is restraint of body and speech.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na yod kyi de yan chad na ni med do //üîΩ'dod pa na yang bsgribs pa med //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na yod kyi de yan chad na ni med do // 'dod pa na yang bsgribs pa med //
translated: In the realm of desire and in the first meditation, there is also informative action and non-informative action.üîΩIn the realm of desire, there is also obscured non-informative action.

original: bsgribs pa'i rnam par rig byed ni 'dod ba'i khams dag na yang med do //
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i rnam par rig byed ni 'dod ba'i khams dag na yang med do //
translated: In the realm of desire, there is also obscured non-informative action.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten 'ba' zhig na yod de //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten 'ba' zhig na yod de //
translated: It exists only in the world of Brahma.

original: tshangs pa chen po'i lus dang ngag gi las ni g-yos kun nas bslang ba'o zhes grag go //üîΩci'i phyir tshangs pa'i 'jig rten yan chad na /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po'i lus dang ngag gi las ni g-yos kun nas bslang ba'o zhes grag go // ci'i phyir tshangs pa'i 'jig rten yan chad na /
translated: The body and speech of Mahabrahma were produced by the movement of his mind.üîΩWhy is there no informative action above the world of BrahmƒÅ?

original: rnam par rig byed med la 'dod pa'i khams dag na yang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa med ce na /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed med la 'dod pa'i khams dag na yang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa med ce na /
translated: Why is there no obscured neutral action in the realm of desire?

original: gang phyir kun slang med /
analyzed: gang phyir kun slang med /
translated: Because there is no intention.

original: rtog @160b pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed na /
analyzed: rtog @160b pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed na /
translated: When the mind that possesses investigation and analysis instigates informative action,

original: de yang bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na med la /
analyzed: de yang bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na med la /
translated: that mind does not exist in the second absorption and above.

original: bsgoms te spang par bya bas yin na /
analyzed: bsgoms te spang par bya bas yin na /
translated: It is abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems de yang 'dod pa'i khams dag na med la /
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems de yang 'dod pa'i khams dag na med la /
translated: That obscured neutral mind does not exist in the realm of desire.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni kha nang du bltas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni kha nang du bltas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing is internal.

original: yang ci kun nas slong ba'i dbang 'ba' zhig gis chos rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge bar rig par bya ba'am zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci kun nas slong ba'i dbang 'ba' zhig gis chos rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge bar rig par bya ba'am zhe na /
translated: Is the virtuous or nonvirtuous nature of all phenomena known only through the power of their motivating intention?

original: smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa ma yin te /
translated: He says that is not so.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types:

original: don dam pa dang / rang bzhin dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas slong bas so //
analyzed: don dam pa dang / rang bzhin dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas slong bas so //
translated: ultimate virtue, natural virtue, concomitant virtue, and virtue that is motivated.üîΩLiberation is virtue ultimately.

original: de la re zhig / thar pa dam pa'i don du dge / sdug bsngal thams cad rnam par zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig / thar pa dam pa'i don du dge / sdug bsngal thams cad rnam par zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: Nirvana is the complete pacification of all suffering.

original: de ni mchog tu bde ba yin pas don dam par de ge ba ste /
analyzed: de ni mchog tu bde ba yin pas don dam par de ge ba ste /
translated: Since it is the highest bliss, it is ultimate virtue,

original: nad med ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nad med ba bzhin no //
translated: like being free of disease.

original: rtsa ba / ngo tsha khrel yod pa bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: rtsa ba / ngo tsha khrel yod pa bdag nyid kyis //
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúShame and embarrassment are natural virtues.‚Äù

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba ste /
translated: The three roots of virtue and shame and embarrassment are natural virtues because

original: mtshungs par gzhan gyis kun nas bslang ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshungs par gzhan gyis kun nas bslang ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir te /
translated: they are not dependent on being motivated by others.

original: 'phrod pa'i sman pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phrod pa'i sman pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like a medicine that is suitable for everyone.

original: de dang ldan rnams mtshungs ldan gyis //
analyzed: de dang ldan rnams mtshungs ldan gyis //
translated: Those who possess them are virtuous through concomitance.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa de dag nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pas dge ba yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa de dag nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pas dge ba yin te /
translated: The dharmas that are associated with those roots of virtue, with shame and with modesty are virtuous by association.

original: de dag dang mi ldan pa rnams la dge ba med pa'i phyir sman dang bsres pa'i btung ba bzhin no //üîΩkun nas bslang bas bya la sogs //
analyzed: de dag dang mi ldan pa rnams la dge ba med pa'i phyir sman dang bsres pa'i btung ba bzhin no // kun nas bslang bas bya la sogs //
translated: They are like a drink mixed with medicine.üîΩKarma that is motivated by them is virtuous by motivation.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa de dag nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi kun du bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las dang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni kun nas bslang bas dge ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa de dag nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi kun du bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las dang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni kun nas bslang bas dge ba ste /
translated: The bodily and vocal actions motivated by those roots of virtue, etc., and the non-associated formative forces are virtuous by motivation.

original: sman dang btung ba las byung ba'i 'o ma bzhin no //üîΩdge ba ji skad du bshad pa de las /
analyzed: sman dang btung ba las byung ba'i 'o ma bzhin no // dge ba ji skad du bshad pa de las /
translated: They are like milk that comes from a cow that has drunk a drink mixed with medicine.üîΩThe opposite of what has been explained as virtuous is non-virtuous.

original: bzlog pa mi dge / ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: bzlog pa mi dge / ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'khor ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyis mchog tu mi bde ba yin pa'i phyir don dam par mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyis mchog tu mi bde ba yin pa'i phyir don dam par mi dge ba'o //
translated: Samsara is nonvirtuous ultimately, because it is the nature of the entry of all suffering and is supremely unpleasant.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The roots of virtue, shamelessness, and lack of abashment are nonvirtuous by nature.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pas so //üîΩdes @161a * //üîΩkun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las dang / thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pas so // des @161a * // kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las dang / thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The phenomena associated with them are nonvirtuous by association.üîΩThe karma of body and speech that is motivated by them,

original: kun nas bslang ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas bslang ba ste /
translated: and acquisition, birth, etc., are nonvirtuous by motivation.

original: nad dang mi 'phrod pa'i sman pa sogs pas dper bya'o //
analyzed: nad dang mi 'phrod pa'i sman pa sogs pas dper bya'o //
translated: They are like a doctor, medicine, etc., that are not suitable for a patient.

original: gal te de ltar na 'khor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa ni cung zad kyang lung du ma bstan pa'am dge bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'khor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa ni cung zad kyang lung du ma bstan pa'am dge bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then because they belong to the realm of samsara, nothing would be neutral or virtuous, since they would be contaminated.

original: don dam par de skad du bshad kyi rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung dum bstan pa gang yin pa de ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: don dam par de skad du bshad kyi rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung dum bstan pa gang yin pa de ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya la /
translated: It is so called in the ultimate sense, but that which is indeterminate in the sense of being karmically indeterminate is called indeterminate.

original: rnam par smin yid du 'ong ba la ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin yid du 'ong ba la ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is karmically wholesome is called wholesome in the sense of being karmically wholesome.

original: gal te don dam par lung dum bstan pa tsam la ni de'i phyir don rnam par /
analyzed: gal te don dam par lung dum bstan pa tsam la ni de'i phyir don rnam par /
translated: If it is only indeterminate in the ultimate sense, then why is it explained in the s≈´tras as follows?

original: lung dum bstan bstan pa dag /'dus ma byas gnyis te /
analyzed: lung dum bstan bstan pa dag /'dus ma byas gnyis te /
translated: The indeterminate is the two unconditioned phenomena.

analyzed: bslab pa thams cad du 'das pa la dris pa dang / bdag gis de lta bu ma byas so zhes zhar la brdzun smra ba /

original: 'di nyes par gnas pa la 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'di nyes par gnas pa la 'gyur bas /

original: de'i phyir brdzun du smra ba spong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir brdzun du smra ba spong ba zhes bya ste /

original: ji ltar 'das par byas kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'das par byas kyang /

original: bdag nyid chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid chags par 'gyur ro //

original: yang ci'i phyir bcas pa'i kha na mtho ba 'di'i bslab pa'i gzhir ma bzhag ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bcas pa'i kha na mtho ba 'di'i bslab pa'i gzhir ma bzhag ce na /

original: gzhag ste / bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba //
analyzed: gzhag ste / bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba //
translated: The bases of training are posited for those who have vows.

original: chang nyid / ci'i phyir chang 'ba' zhig yin la gzhan gyi ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: chang nyid / ci'i phyir chang 'ba' zhig yin la gzhan gyi ma yin zhe na /

original: gzhan ni srung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan ni srung ba'i phyir /

original: chang 'thung na yan lag gzhan dang gzhan dag mi srung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: chang 'thung na yan lag gzhan dang gzhan dag mi srung bar 'gyur bas /

original: de'i phyir de 'ba' zhig gis bslab pa'i gzhi rnam par gzhag gi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'ba' zhig gis bslab pa'i gzhi rnam par gzhag gi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no //

original: so sor thar pa dang / bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa gang yin pa gsum po 'di dag /
analyzed: so sor thar pa dang / bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa gang yin pa gsum po 'di dag /

analyzed: ji 'di dag las gcig 'thob pa de las lhag ma rnams kyang 'thob pa ma zhe na /
translated: If one obtains one of these, does one also obtain the remaining ones?

original: smras pa / ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin te /
translated: It is said: No.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩAll belonging to the desire realm are obtained by both.

original: 'dod gtogs thams cad gnyi ga dang // da ltar gyi las thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod gtogs thams cad gnyi ga dang // da ltar gyi las thob par 'gyur //

original: 'dod gtogs zhes bya ba ni so sor thar @168a * //
analyzed: 'dod gtogs zhes bya ba ni so sor thar @168a * //
translated: Belonging to the desire realm refers to pratimoksa vows.

original: ba'i sdom pa yin no //
analyzed: ba'i sdom pa yin no //

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / dngos dang / mjug las so //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / dngos dang / mjug las so //

original: gnyi ga las zhes bya ba ni sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa dang / rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba las so //
analyzed: gnyi ga las zhes bya ba ni sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa dang / rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba las so //
translated: Both means from sentient beings and non-sentient beings, and from natural and proscribed offenses.

original: sems can gyi rten du tha snyad btags pa'i phyir da ltar gyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'ba' zhig las 'thob kyi /
analyzed: sems can gyi rten du tha snyad btags pa'i phyir da ltar gyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'ba' zhig las 'thob kyi /

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa las ni ma yin te /

original: de dag ni sems can du ni mi bgrang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sems can du ni mi bgrang ba'i phyir ro //

original: bsam gtan zag med sdom gnyis ni //
analyzed: bsam gtan zag med sdom gnyis ni //
translated: The two restraints of absorption and uncontaminated

original: dngos dang dus ni thams cad las //üîΩbsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa gnyis ni dngos kyi lam 'ba' zhig las 'thob kyi /
analyzed: dngos dang dus ni thams cad las // bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa gnyis ni dngos kyi lam 'ba' zhig las 'thob kyi /
translated: states arise from the actual basis and all times.

original: sbyor ba dang mjug las kyang ma yin na bcas pa'i kha na ma thob las lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang mjug las kyang ma yin na bcas pa'i kha na ma thob las lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: The two restraints of absorption and uncontaminated states arise from the actual basis alone and not from preparation or conclusion, so what need is there to mention that they do not arise from proscribed offenses?

original: dus thams cad las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i phung po dang / khams dang skye mched las kyang 'thob bo ;
analyzed: dus thams cad las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i phung po dang / khams dang skye mched las kyang 'thob bo ;
translated: It is also obtained from the aggregates, elements and bases of the past and future that transcend all time.

original: / yang ci sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa gnyis sems can thams cad dang / yan lag thams cad dang / rgyu thams cad las 'thob bam /
analyzed: / yang ci sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa gnyis sems can thams cad dang / yan lag thams cad dang / rgyu thams cad las 'thob bam /
translated: Are vows and nonvows obtained from all sentient beings, all branches and all causes?

original: 'on te bye brag yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te bye brag yod ce na /
translated: Or are there distinctions?

original: smras pa / yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / yod de /
translated: It is said:üîΩThere are distinctions.

original: re zhig nges par 'thob pa ni //
analyzed: re zhig nges par 'thob pa ni //
translated: Vows are definitely obtained

original: sdom pa sems can thams cad las //
analyzed: sdom pa sems can thams cad las //
translated: from all sentient beings.

original: yan lag rgyu las dbye ba yod //üîΩsdom pa ni sems can thams cad las 'thob pa nyid de /
analyzed: yan lag rgyu las dbye ba yod // sdom pa ni sems can thams cad las 'thob pa nyid de /
translated: There are distinctions in terms of branches and causes.

original: 'ga' las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' las ni ma yin no //
translated: Vows are obtained from all sentient beings and not from some.

original: yan lag ni dbye ba yod de /
analyzed: yan lag ni dbye ba yod de /
translated: There are distinctions in terms of branches.

original: kha cig ni thams cad las 'thob ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni thams cad las 'thob ste /
translated: Some are obtained from all,

original: dge slong gi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa'o //
translated: such as the vows of a fully ordained monk.

original: kha cig ni bzhi las te /üîΩde las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni bzhi las te / de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: Some are obtained from four,üîΩsuch as the vows of a novice and so on.

original: las kyi lam rnams ni sdom pa'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: las kyi lam rnams ni sdom pa'i yan lag yin no //
translated: The karmic paths are branches of vows.

original: rgyu las kyang kha cig ni rnam grangs thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: rgyu las kyang kha cig ni rnam grangs thams cad kyis so //
translated: Some are obtained from all causes.

original: kha cig ni gcig gi ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni gcig gi ste /
translated: Some say: One obtains it from one.

original: re zhig thams cad kyi zhes bya ba gang gis she na /
analyzed: re zhig thams cad kyi zhes bya ba gang gis she na /
translated: From all?

original: gal te ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa rnams la rgyu dag tu 'dod pa na'o //
analyzed: gal te ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa rnams la rgyu dag tu 'dod pa na'o //
translated: If one accepts that nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion are causes.

original: gcig gis zhes bya ba gang gis she na /
analyzed: gcig gis zhes bya ba gang gis she na /
translated: From one?

original: gal te sems chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnams las rgyu dag tu 'dod pa na'o //
analyzed: gal te sems chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnams las rgyu dag tu 'dod pa na'o //
translated: If one accepts that the small, medium, and great minds are causes.

original: gang las sdom pa thob pa bshad zin to //üîΩsdom pa min pa thams cad dang // yan lag kun la rgyus min no //
analyzed: gang las sdom pa thob pa bshad zin to // sdom pa min pa thams cad dang // yan lag kun la rgyus min no //
translated: It has been explained from where one obtains vows.üîΩNonvows are obtainedüîΩfrom all sentient beings, not from all causes.

original: sems can thams cad dag las @168b kyi lam thams cad las 'thob ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dag las @168b kyi lam thams cad las 'thob ste /
translated: One obtains nonvows from all sentient beings, not from all paths of action.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa tshang ba'i sdom pa ma yin pa can ni med do //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa tshang ba'i sdom pa ma yin pa can ni med do //
translated: There is no one who is completely filled with nonvows.

original: rgyu thams cad kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu thams cad kyis ni ma yin te /

analyzed: sems chung du la sogs ba cig car du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //

original: sdom pa ma yin pa gang las 'thob pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa gang las 'thob pa bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained from where one obtains nonvows.

analyzed: ji ltar 'thob ba ni ma bshad pas de'i phyir brjod par bya ste / sdom pa min ba'i sdom pa'am //
translated: Since it has not been explained how vows are obtained, we will now discuss this.üîΩVows are obtained from nonvows

original: khas len pa las thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: khas len pa las thob par 'gyur //
translated: and from accepting them.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis 'thob ste /
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis 'thob ste /

original: de'i rigs can rnams ni gsod par sbyor ba'i sbyor ba las so //
analyzed: de'i rigs can rnams ni gsod par sbyor ba'i sbyor ba las so //

original: de'i rigs can ma yin pa rnams ni 'di skad du bdag cag kyang 'tsho ba 'dis 'tsho bar bya'o zhes khas len pa las so //
analyzed: de'i rigs can ma yin pa rnams ni 'di skad du bdag cag kyang 'tsho ba 'dis 'tsho bar bya'o zhes khas len pa las so //
translated: Those who are not of that type obtain them from accepting them, saying, I too will live by this livelihood.

original: lhag ma'i rnam rig mi 'thob pa //
analyzed: lhag ma'i rnam rig mi 'thob pa //
translated: One does not obtain the other.üîΩOne obtains the other from the field,

original: zhing dang len dang gus byed pas //
analyzed: zhing dang len dang gus byed pas //
translated: from accepting them, and from respecting them.

original: lhag ma gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: lhag ma gang zhig ce na /

analyzed: sdom pa'ang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa zhes bya'o //

original: de dag gi zhing la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'thob ste /
analyzed: de dag gi zhing la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'thob ste /

analyzed: gang du kun dga'i ra ba la sogs pa phul ba tsam gyis rnam bar rig byed ma yin pa skye ba ni de dang mthun ba'i zhing yin te /

analyzed: 'di lta ste rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dag las sam /
translated: from the basis of merit that is neither a substance nor not a substance.

analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal gyi bar du zan mi za'o zhes bya ba dang / tshes sam zla ba phyed dam zla ba gcig cing yang rtag tu mchod ston bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi dam yang dag par blangs pa'am /
translated: Or it arises from the perfect acceptance of a vow, such as, I will not eat until I have paid homage to the Buddha, or I will always make offerings on the new moon, the full moon, or the eighth day of every month, or half a month, or one month, and so on.

original: dge ba'am mi dge ba dag las rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur ba de dang mthun pa'i las gus par byed pa las so //
analyzed: dge ba'am mi dge ba dag las rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur ba de dang mthun pa'i las gus par byed pa las so //
translated: Or it arises from virtuous or nonvirtuous karma that is respectful.

original: sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa rnams ji ltar 'thob pa 'di ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa rnams ji ltar 'thob pa 'di ni bshad zin to //
translated: The obtainment of vows and nonvows has already been explained.

original: da ni sdom pa brjod par bya ste /üîΩde la re zhig so sor thar ba'i 'dul gtong ba //
analyzed: da ni sdom pa brjod par bya ste / de la re zhig so sor thar ba'i 'dul gtong ba //
translated: Now the vows will be explained.üîΩThe pratimoksa vows are relinquishedüîΩby offering back the training, death,

original: bslab pa phul dang shi 'phos dang // mtshan gnyis dag ni 'byung ba dang // rtsa ba chad dang mtshan 'das las //
analyzed: bslab pa phul dang shi 'phos dang // mtshan gnyis dag ni 'byung ba dang // rtsa ba chad dang mtshan 'das las //
translated: changing sex, cutting the root,üîΩor the night ending.

original: des 'dul bar byed pas na 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: des 'dul bar byed pas na 'dul ba ste /
translated: It is called vinaya because it disciplines.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yin par dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is the pratimoksa vow that is intended.

original: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ma gtogs par /
analyzed: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ma gtogs par /
translated: Except for the upavƒÅsa vow,

original: de ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis gtong ste /üîΩmi brda phrad pa'i drung du bslab pa'i gzhi rnams bsam pa thag pa nas slar phul ba'am /
analyzed: de ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis gtong ste / mi brda phrad pa'i drung du bslab pa'i gzhi rnams bsam pa thag pa nas slar phul ba'am /
translated: it is relinquished through four causes:üîΩreturning the bases of training to the Buddha in the presence of a human capable of understanding,

original: ris mthun pa btang ba'am /üîΩmtshan gnyis @169a * //
analyzed: ris mthun pa btang ba'am / mtshan gnyis @169a * //
translated: abandoning the class affiliation,

original: cig car du byung ba'am /
analyzed: cig car du byung ba'am /
translated: simultaneously possessing two organs,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa las so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa las so //
translated: or severing the root of virtue.

original: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ni de dag dang mtshan mo zad pa las te /
analyzed: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ni de dag dang mtshan mo zad pa las te /
translated: The upavƒÅsa vow is relinquished by those causes and by the end of the night.

original: de ltar na de dag ni bsdu na gtong ba'i rgyu lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni bsdu na gtong ba'i rgyu lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in summary, they are relinquished by five causes.

original: ci'i phyir rgyu de dag gis gtong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyu de dag gis gtong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why are they relinquished by those causes?

original: yang dag par blangs pa dang 'gal ba'i rnam bar rig byed bskyed pa'i phyir ba dang / lus bor ba'i phyir ba dang / rten nyams pa'i phyir ba dang / gzhi chad pa'i phyir ba dang / de srid du 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa dang 'gal ba'i rnam bar rig byed bskyed pa'i phyir ba dang / lus bor ba'i phyir ba dang / rten nyams pa'i phyir ba dang / gzhi chad pa'i phyir ba dang / de srid du 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it generates indicative form that is incompatible with the vows properly taken, because the body is discarded, because the basis is damaged, because the basis is severed, and because it is projected for a limited time.

original: kha cig ltung bar 'gyur las smra //
analyzed: kha cig ltung bar 'gyur las smra //
translated: Some say: It is relinquished by the action of downfalls.

original: gzhan dag na re ltung bar 'gyur ba bzhi las gang yang rung ba zhig gis dge slong dang dge sbyong gi sbom pa gtong ngo zhes zer ro //üîΩgzhan dag dam chos nub pa las //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni dam pa'i chos nub pa las sdom pa gtong ngo zhes zer ro //

original: bu lon nor bzhin kha cha rnams //
analyzed: bu lon nor bzhin kha cha rnams //

original: byung ba la yang gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: byung ba la yang gnyis su 'dod //

original: kha che bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: kha che bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /

analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung ba la sdom pa gtong ba med de /
translated: The vows are not relinquished by the occurrence of a root downfall.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: phyogs gcig zhig pas sdom pa zad par gtong ba ni mi rigs so zhes zer ro //
translated: It is not logical that the destruction of one part would cause the destruction of the vow.

original: ltung ba gzhan byung ba la yang tshul khrims 'chal ba ni med de /
analyzed: ltung ba gzhan byung ba la yang tshul khrims 'chal ba ni med de /
translated: Also, one who commits another downfall is not immoral.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

original: 'di la tshul khrims dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims gnyi ga yang yod pas /
analyzed: 'di la tshul khrims dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims gnyi ga yang yod pas /

analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig la nor yang bdog bu lon yang chags pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a person may have wealth and also owe a debt.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa ni ma yin te /

original: dper na bu lon bcal nas nor dang ldan par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bu lon bcal nas nor dang ldan par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, one becomes endowed with wealth through paying off a debt.

analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ji ltar gteng ba bshad zin to //
translated: The topic of the relinquishment of pratimoksa vows has been explained.

analyzed: yang bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa gnyis ji ltar gtong zhe na /
translated: How are the two vows of meditative discipline and uncontaminated discipline relinquished?

original: bsam gtan gtogs pa'i dge ba ni //
analyzed: bsam gtan gtogs pa'i dge ba ni //
translated: Virtuous minds belonging to the absorptions

original: sa 'phos nyams pa gnyis kyis gtong ngo //
analyzed: sa 'phos nyams pa gnyis kyis gtong ngo //

analyzed: bsam gtan du gtogs pa'i dge ba thams cad ni rgyu gnyis kyis gtong ste /

original: steng ngam 'og tu skye ba las te /
analyzed: steng ngam 'og tu skye ba las te /

original: sa 'phos pa las sam snyoms par 'jug pa las te /
analyzed: sa 'phos pa las sam snyoms par 'jug pa las te /

original: yongs su nyams pa las so //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa las so //
