translated: The word ‚Äúthis‚Äù is mentioned in order to show that it exists only in the realm of desire.

original: 'di dag gi 'bras bu ni tshor ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
analyzed: 'di dag gi 'bras bu ni tshor ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
translated: The result of these actions is not only sensation.

original: 'di ltar phung po lnga 'khor dang bcas pa yang yin no //üîΩ'o na'ang bar ma yod do zhes //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lnga 'khor dang bcas pa yang yin no // 'o na'ang bar ma yod do zhes //
translated: The five aggregates and what is associated with them are also the result.

original: kha cig zer te /
analyzed: kha cig zer te /
translated: But some say that there is a middle action.üîΩSome say that there is a middle action, because there is a middle result.

original: gzhan dag na re bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba bshad pa'i las bar ma las bar ma bsam gtan bzhi pa man chad na yang yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba bshad pa'i las bar ma las bar ma bsam gtan bzhi pa man chad na yang yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that there is a middle action, the action whose result is to be experienced as neither pleasure nor pain, which is explained in the sutra.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why do they say this?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: bsam gtan khyad par rnam smin las //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par rnam smin las //
translated: the special meditative stabilization is the result of action.

original: de lta ma yin na bsam gtan khyad par can gyi las kyi rnam par smin ba yang med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bsam gtan khyad par can gyi las kyi rnam par smin ba yang med par 'gyur la /
translated: If it were not so, then the special meditative stabilization would not be the result of action.

original: las gang gis kyang bsam gtan khyad par can du rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: las gang gis kyang bsam gtan khyad par can du rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And no action would have the special meditative stabilization as its result,

original: de nas bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because neither pleasure nor pain exist there.

original: snga phyi med gsum smin 'dod phyir //
analyzed: snga phyi med gsum smin 'dod phyir //
translated: Because they assert that the three are the results of action,

original: 'di ltar las gsum po rnams kyi rnam par smin pa snga phyi med par rnam par smin par 'gyur ram zhes pa la 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar las gsum po rnams kyi rnam par smin pa snga phyi med par rnam par smin par 'gyur ram zhes pa la 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, does the maturation of the three karmas occur without a sequence of earlier and later?

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i ni gzugs so //
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i ni gzugs so //
translated: The maturation of karma to be experienced as pleasure is form.

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The maturation of karma to be experienced as pain is the mind and mental factors.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams so zhes bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams so zhes bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: The maturation of karma to be experienced as neither pleasure nor pain is the formations not concomitant with the mind.üîΩThus, it is explained.

original: 'og ma yang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yod do //
analyzed: 'og ma yang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yod do //
translated: But there is karma to be experienced as neither pleasure nor pain in the lower realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las gzhan na ni las gsum bo cig car du rnam par smin pa'i 'brel ba med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las gzhan na ni las gsum bo cig car du rnam par smin pa'i 'brel ba med do //
translated: But apart from the desire realm, there is no connection for the three karmas to ripen simultaneously.

original: las ni tshor ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na /
analyzed: las ni tshor ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na /
translated: If karma is not by nature feeling,

original: ji ltar bde ba myong bar 'gyur @171b ba zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bde ba myong bar 'gyur @171b ba zhes brjod ce na /
translated: how can it be said that it is to be experienced as pleasure?

original: rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba las dgongs te gsungs pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba las dgongs te gsungs pas nyes pa med do //
translated: The response is that there is no fault, because the Buddha spoke with the intention of the experience of the karmic maturation.

original: gzhan yang / rang bzhin dang ni mtshungs ldan dang // dmigs pa dang ni rnam smin dang // mngon sum du ni gyur ba las //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rang bzhin dang ni mtshungs ldan dang // dmigs pa dang ni rnam smin dang // mngon sum du ni gyur ba las //
translated: Moreover,

original: myong bar 'gyur ba rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur ba rnam pa lnga //
translated: experience is fivefold:üîΩby nature, by concomitance, by object, by maturation, and by manifestation.

original: da la rang bzhin gyis myong bar 'gyur ba ni tshor ba rnams so //üîΩmtshungs par ldan bas myong bar 'gyur ba ni reg pa'i ste /üîΩbde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da la rang bzhin gyis myong bar 'gyur ba ni tshor ba rnams so // mtshungs par ldan bas myong bar 'gyur ba ni reg pa'i ste / bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Among these, experience by nature is the feeling.

original: dmigs pa myong bar 'gyur ba ni yul rnams te /üîΩji skad du mig gis gzugs rnams mthong na gzugs so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa myong bar 'gyur ba ni yul rnams te / ji skad du mig gis gzugs rnams mthong na gzugs so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Experience by concomitance is contact, because it is said, ‚ÄúThe faculty of pleasure arises in dependence on the three. ‚Äù

original: gzugs las 'dod chags so sor yang dag bar myong ba ni ma yin no zhas bya ba la sogs ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs las 'dod chags so sor yang dag bar myong ba ni ma yin no zhas bya ba la sogs ba ste /
translated: Experience by object is the object, because it is said, ‚ÄúWhen the eye sees forms, it experiences forms, but it does not experience desire for forms. ‚Äù

original: tshor bas dmigs pa de dag yang dag par so sor rig par byed do //
analyzed: tshor bas dmigs pa de dag yang dag par so sor rig par byed do //
translated: Feeling experiences the object that is experienced.

original: rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: The action that is experienced as a ripened effect is called action experienced in this life, etc.

original: mngon sum du gyur ba'i myong bar 'gyur ba ni ji skad du gang gi tshe bde ba'i tshor ba myong bar byed pa de'i tshe tshor ba gnyis 'gag bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur ba'i myong bar 'gyur ba ni ji skad du gang gi tshe bde ba'i tshor ba myong bar byed pa de'i tshe tshor ba gnyis 'gag bar 'gyur te /
translated: The experience of the present is as follows: When one experiences a pleasant feeling, at that time two feelings cease.

original: gang du bde ba'i tshor ba 'jug pa der de dag tu gang gis myong bar 'gyur ba'i tshor ba gzhan ni med kyi de'i mngon sum du byed pa la de dag tu myong bar byed pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gang du bde ba'i tshor ba 'jug pa der de dag tu gang gis myong bar 'gyur ba'i tshor ba gzhan ni med kyi de'i mngon sum du byed pa la de dag tu myong bar byed pa zhes brjod de /
translated: When a pleasant feeling occurs, there is no other feeling that experiences it, but it is said that it is experienced by that which makes it present.

original: de bas na rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir las kyang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir las kyang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because it is the experience of the ripened effect, action is called that which is experienced as pleasant, etc.

original: de yang nges dang ma nges pa //
analyzed: de yang nges dang ma nges pa //
translated: It is definite or indefinite.

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i las rnam pa gsum po de dag kyang nges pa dang ma nges par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i las rnam pa gsum po de dag kyang nges pa dang ma nges par rig par bya ste /
translated: These three types of karma to be experienced as pleasure, etc. should be understood as definite or indefinite.

original: gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not definitely experienced.

original: mthong ba'i chos la sogs pa la //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la sogs pa la //
translated: Karma to be experienced in the current life, etc.

original: myong 'gyur phyir na nges rnam gsum //üîΩmthong ba'i chos la chos myong bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang // lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: myong 'gyur phyir na nges rnam gsum // mthong ba'i chos la chos myong bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang // lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: is definite because it is experienced.

original: las rnam pa 'di gsum ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: las rnam pa 'di gsum ni nges pa'o //
translated: Karma to be experienced in the current life, karma to be experienced after taking rebirth, and karma to be experienced in a third life are the three types of definite karma.

original: de ltar na de dag ni myong bar 'gyur ba ma nges pa dang bcas te /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni myong bar 'gyur ba ma nges pa dang bcas te /
translated: Thus, these are definite karma and indefinite karma,

original: rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: which are four types of karma.

original: kha cig las rnam lnga zhes zer //
analyzed: kha cig las rnam lnga zhes zer //
translated: Some say karma is five types.

original: gzhan dag ni myong bar 'gyur ba ma nges pa la rnam par smin par nges pa dang ma nges pa rnam pa gnyis su phye nas las rnam pa lngar 'dod @172a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni myong bar 'gyur ba ma nges pa la rnam par smin par nges pa dang ma nges pa rnam pa gnyis su phye nas las rnam pa lngar 'dod @172a * //
translated: Others say karma is five types by dividing indefinite karma to be experienced into two: karma to be experienced that is definite and karma to be experienced that is indefinite.

original: do ; / de la mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ni skye ba gang du byas pa de nyid du rnam par smin pa'o //üîΩskyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba ni skyes ba gnyis pa la'o //
analyzed: do ; / de la mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ni skye ba gang du byas pa de nyid du rnam par smin pa'o // skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba ni skyes ba gnyis pa la'o //
translated: Karma to be experienced in the present life is that whose result ripens in the very lifetime in which it is committed.üîΩKarma to be experienced after rebirth is that whose result ripens in the second lifetime.

original: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ni de phan chad du'o //
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ni de phan chad du'o //
translated: Karma to be experienced in a successive rebirth is that whose result ripens in the third lifetime and beyond.

original: mu bzhi zhes ni kha cig smra //
analyzed: mu bzhi zhes ni kha cig smra //
translated: Some say: There are four possibilities.

original: gzhan dag ni gnas skabs nges la rnam par smin pa ma nges pa'i las kyang yod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gnas skabs nges la rnam par smin pa ma nges pa'i las kyang yod de /
translated: Others say: There is karma whose time is definite but whose result is indefinite.

original: mthong ba'i chos la sogs pa la myong bar 'gyur ba rnam par smin par ni ma nges pa'i las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la sogs pa la myong bar 'gyur ba rnam par smin par ni ma nges pa'i las gang yin pa'o //
translated: Karma whose result is indefinite but whose time is definite is karma to be experienced in the current life and so on, but whose result is not definite.

original: rnam par smin par nges la gnas skabs dag tu ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam par smin par nges la gnas skabs dag tu ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is karma whose result is definite but whose time is indefinite.

original: rnam par smin pa nges la myong bar 'gyur bar ni ma nges pa'i las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa nges la myong bar 'gyur bar ni ma nges pa'i las gang yin pa'o //
translated: Karma whose result is definite but whose time is indefinite is karma whose result is definite but which is not definite to be experienced.

original: gnyi ga nges pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gnyi ga nges pa yang yod de /
translated: There is karma whose time and result are both definite.

original: mthong ba'i chos la sogs pa la myong bar yang 'gyur la rnam par smin par yang nges pa'i las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la sogs pa la myong bar yang 'gyur la rnam par smin par yang nges pa'i las gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is action the effects of which are experienced in the present life, etc.

original: gnyi ga ma nges pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma nges pa yang yod do //
translated: There is action which is not determined with regard to both.üîΩIt is action the effects of which are not determined to be experienced.

original: myong bar 'gyur bar yang ma nges la rnam par smin par yang ma nges pa'i las gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba mu bzhir 'chad do //
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur bar yang ma nges la rnam par smin par yang ma nges pa'i las gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba mu bzhir 'chad do //
translated: Thus there are four alternatives.

original: las bzhi po de dag las gsum gyis ris su 'phen par byed /
analyzed: las bzhi po de dag las gsum gyis ris su 'phen par byed /
translated: Three of these four actions project the life-stream.

original: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis ni ris mthun bar 'phen par mi byed do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis ni ris mthun bar 'phen par mi byed do //
translated: Action the effects of which are experienced in the present life does not project the life-stream.

original: yang khams gang dag gam 'gro ba gang dag na las kyi 'phen pa du zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: yang khams gang dag gam 'gro ba gang dag na las kyi 'phen pa du zhig yod ce na /
translated: In which realms and in which planes of existence are the actions of the four types projected?

original: thams cad na ni 'phen pa bzhi //
analyzed: thams cad na ni 'phen pa bzhi //
translated: All the realms and planes of existence contain the four types of actions.

original: khams gsum po thams cad dang 'gro ba thams cad na dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams las ji ltar srid par las bzhi'i 'phen pa yod de /
analyzed: khams gsum po thams cad dang 'gro ba thams cad na dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams las ji ltar srid par las bzhi'i 'phen pa yod de /
translated: In all the realms and in all the planes of existence, the four types of action, wholesome and unwholesome, are projected, according to the case.

original: de ni spyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni spyir bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the general rule.

original: 'di ni dmigs kyis bstan pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs kyis bstan pa ste //
translated: This is a specific teaching.

original: dmyal ba na ni dge ba'i gsum //
analyzed: dmyal ba na ni dge ba'i gsum //
translated: In hell, there are three types of wholesome karma.

original: dmyal ba na ni las dge ba'i 'phen pa rnam pa gsum yod kyi mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ni med de /
analyzed: dmyal ba na ni las dge ba'i 'phen pa rnam pa gsum yod kyi mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ni med de /
translated: In hell, there are three types of wholesome karma that are projected, but none that is experienced in the current life.

original: de ni rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang la 'dod chags bral bstan pa'i //
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba med pa'i phyir ro // gang la 'dod chags bral bstan pa'i //
translated: Because there is no pleasant karmic maturation there.üîΩThe S≈´tra says that a fool is not born there,

original: byis ba der skye myong mi byed //
analyzed: byis ba der skye myong mi byed //
translated: but one free from attachment is taught.

original: byis pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: byis pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: A fool is an ordinary person.

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i rigs can te /
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i rigs can te /
translated: One free from attachment is one of the families that do not retrogress.

original: de ni sa gang la 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni mi byed de gzhan rnam pa gsum byed do //
analyzed: de ni sa gang la 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni mi byed de gzhan rnam pa gsum byed do //
translated: He does not create karma to be experienced after rebirth in the stage from which he is free, but he does create the other three types.

original: 'phags pa gzhan du'ang myong mi byed //üîΩbstan pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'phags pa gzhan du'ang myong mi byed //üîΩbstan pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: An ƒÅrya is not born in other places.üîΩThe S≈´tra says that an ƒÅrya is not born in other places.

original: gang la @172b 'dod chags dang bral ba yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can gyi 'phags pa'i gang zag ni der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyang mi byed de /
analyzed: gang la @172b 'dod chags dang bral ba yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can gyi 'phags pa'i gang zag ni der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyang mi byed de /
translated: Noble persons who are free from attachment to a realm and who do not degenerate do not create karma to be experienced in the current life or in the next life.

original: 'di ni yang 'og mar skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yang 'og mar skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is illogical that they would be born in lower realms.

original: gang du skyes par ma nges pa dang / mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ni byed do //üîΩ'dod rtse'i mi bstan pa yang min //
analyzed: gang du skyes par ma nges pa dang / mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ni byed do // 'dod rtse'i mi bstan pa yang min //
translated: They create karma to be experienced in a time not specified, or in the next rebirth, or in a subsequent rebirth.

original: 'dod pa'i khams sam /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams sam /
translated: They do not create karma to be experienced in the desire realm or the summit of existence.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'phags pa gang zag de gnyis ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin yang skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byed par ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'phags pa gang zag de gnyis ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin yang skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byed par ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Noble persons who are free from attachment to the desire realm or the summit of existence do not create karma to be experienced in the current life or in the next life, even though they may degenerate.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa yin la /
translated: They have degenerated from their result.

original: 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa la ni 'chi ba med do zhes 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa la ni 'chi ba med do zhes 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: It is said that one who fully degenerates from the result does not die.

original: ci srid pa bar ma dag na yang las kyi 'phen pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci srid pa bar ma dag na yang las kyi 'phen pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do karmic impulsions exist in the intermediate existence?

original: smras pa yod de /
analyzed: smras pa yod de /
translated: They say that they do.

original: srid pa bar ma 'dod khams su //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma 'dod khams su //
translated: The intermediate existence of the desire realm

original: 'phen pa rnam pa nyi shu gnyis /
analyzed: 'phen pa rnam pa nyi shu gnyis /
translated: is impelled by twenty two types.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i srid pa bar ma ni las rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'phen te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i srid pa bar ma ni las rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'phen te /
translated: The intermediate existence of the desire realm is impelled by twenty two types of karma.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mngal gyi gnas skabs lnga ste /
analyzed: mngal gyi gnas skabs lnga ste /
translated: There are five stages of the womb:

original: nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / nar nar po dang / gor gor po dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa rnams dang / skyes pa'i gnas skabs lnga ste /
analyzed: nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / nar nar po dang / gor gor po dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa rnams dang / skyes pa'i gnas skabs lnga ste /
translated: kalala, arbuda, pe≈õin, ghana and pra≈õƒÅkhƒÅ, and five stages after birth:

original: byis pa dang / gzhon du dang / dar la bab pa dang / dar yol ba dang / rgan po'i gnas skabs rnams so //
analyzed: byis pa dang / gzhon du dang / dar la bab pa dang / dar yol ba dang / rgan po'i gnas skabs rnams so //
translated: child, youth, adult, middle age and old age.

original: de la srid pa bar ma ni nur nur po myong bar 'gyur ba nges pa dang / ma nges pa'i las kyang 'phen par byed la /
analyzed: de la srid pa bar ma ni nur nur po myong bar 'gyur ba nges pa dang / ma nges pa'i las kyang 'phen par byed la /
translated: The intermediate existence of the desire realm impels karma to be experienced as kalala and so on, which is certain and uncertain.

original: de bzhin du rgan po'i bar du myong bar 'gyur ba dang / srid pa bar ma myong bar 'gyur ba yang 'phen par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgan po'i bar du myong bar 'gyur ba dang / srid pa bar ma myong bar 'gyur ba yang 'phen par byed do //
translated: Karma to be experienced in the current life

original: nyon mongs pa dang drag po dang // yon tan zhing dang rgyun chags kyis //üîΩbyas pa gang zhig yin pa dang // pham gsod gang de nges so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang drag po dang // yon tan zhing dang rgyun chags kyis // byas pa gang zhig yin pa dang // pham gsod gang de nges so //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa drag pos byed pa'i las gang yin ba'am /

analyzed: dang ba drag pos byed pa'i las gang yin pa'am / rgyun du byed pa gang yin pa'am /

analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis 'bras bu khyad par can dang / snyoms par 'jug pa khyad par can thob pa'i gang zag khyad par can te /

analyzed: de dag la ni nyon mongs pa dang dang ba drag po dang rgyun du byed pa med par yang dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las nges par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: pha ma la ni ba dang ma gnyis gsod pa'i las ji lta bu yang rung ste /

original: de ni nges par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni nges par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: The action is certain, but not the other.

original: yang mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu ci 'dra bar rig bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu ci 'dra bar rig bar bya zhe na /
translated: What is the karma whose result is experienced in the current life?

original: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu ni //
translated: Karma whose result is experienced in the current life

original: zhing dang bsam ba'i khyad par las /
analyzed: zhing dang bsam ba'i khyad par las /
translated: is due to the distinction of field and intention.üîΩKarma whose result is experienced in the current life is due to the distinction of field and intention.

original: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur pa'i las zhing gi khyad par las 'gyur ba ni dpen na dge slong gi dge 'dun la bud med do zhes rtsod pa kun du spyod pa las mtshan yongs su gyur to zhes grags pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par las ni dper na nyung rum zhig gis glang gi rlig pa 'byin pa las thar bar bya ba'i phyir skyes pa nyid du gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Karma whose result is experienced in the current life due to the distinction of intention is, for example, like the case of a eunuch who became a man in order to be released from the punishment of having his testicles removed.

original: sa der 'dod chags gtan bral phyir //
analyzed: sa der 'dod chags gtan bral phyir //
translated: Because one is completely free of attachment to that level.

original: dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las sa gang yin pa der gtan du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir las las de mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las sa gang yin pa der gtan du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir las las de mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because one is completely detached from any realm where one could experience the effects of either wholesome or unwholesome karma, the effects of that karma are experienced in the present life.

original: las ji lta bu zhig ce na smras pa /
analyzed: las ji lta bu zhig ce na smras pa /
translated: What kind of karma is it?

original: de ni rnam smin nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam smin nges pa'o //
translated: It is karma whose effects are certain.

original: de da ltar nges pa'i las gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin par nges kyi /
analyzed: de da ltar nges pa'i las gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin par nges kyi /
translated: Karma whose effects are certain in the present is karma whose effects are certain.

original: gnas skabs dag tu ma yin no //üîΩgnas skabs kyi bye brag tu nges pa gang yin pa de'i ni de dang ldan bzhin du gtan du 'dod chags dang bral mi srid pas de nyid du rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //

translated: It is not karma whose effects are uncertain.üîΩKarma whose effects are uncertain in a particular state is karma whose effects are experienced in the present life because it is impossible for one to be completely detached from that state while possessing that karma.

original: gang yang ma nges pa de'i ni gtan du 'dod chags dang @173b bral ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang ma nges pa de'i ni gtan du 'dod chags dang @173b bral ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa nyid do //
translated: Karma whose effects are uncertain is karma whose effects are experienced in the present life because it is impossible for one to be completely detached from that state while possessing that karma.

original: yang gang du gdon mi za bar mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las su 'gyur ba'i zhing yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang gang du gdon mi za bar mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las su 'gyur ba'i zhing yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /

analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas la sogs ba dge slong gi dge 'dun dang gang zag lnga rnams te /
translated: The five persons are the Buddha and so on, the sa·πÖgha of monks, and the five persons.

original: gang rnams 'gog byams nyon mongs med //
analyzed: gang rnams 'gog byams nyon mongs med //
translated: Those who are in cessation, loving kindness, without affliction,

original: mthong dang dgra bcom 'bras langs rnams //
analyzed: mthong dang dgra bcom 'bras langs rnams //
translated: who have seen and arisen from the result of arhatship,

original: de la phan gnod byed pa yi //
analyzed: de la phan gnod byed pa yi //
translated: for whom there is benefit and harm,

original: 'bras bu 'phral du myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'phral du myong bar 'gyur //

original: gang zag lnga po de dag la phan pa dang / gnod pa byas ba rnams kyi 'bras bu nges par mthong ba'i chos nyid la thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag lnga po de dag la phan pa dang / gnod pa byas ba rnams kyi 'bras bu nges par mthong ba'i chos nyid la thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The result of benefit and harm done to those five persons is definitely experienced in this very life.

original: rnam par smin pa'i gtso bo ni tshor ba yin pas de'i phyir 'di spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i gtso bo ni tshor ba yin pas de'i phyir 'di spyad par bya ste /

analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa sems kyi tshor ba 'ba' zhig yin la /
translated: Is there only mental feeling as the karmic maturation of karma,

original: lus kyi ma yin pa yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi ma yin pa yang yod dam zhe na /

original: smras pa yod de /üîΩrnam par rtog pa med pa yi //
analyzed: smras pa yod de / rnam par rtog pa med pa yi //

original: dge ba'i las kyi rnam smin ni //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi rnam smin ni //

analyzed: sems kyi tshor ba nyid du 'dod //

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i las ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i las ni /

original: bsam gtan khyad par can dag nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar dag na yod de /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can dag nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar dag na yod de /
translated: It exists from the intermediate meditation up to the summit of cyclic existence.

analyzed: dge ba'i las rtog pa med pa de'i rnam par smin pa ni sems 'ba' zhig gi tshor ba yin no //

original: ci'i phyir lus kyi ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lus kyi ma yin zhe na /

original: de'i ni gdon mi za bar rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi dge ba ni lus kyi nyid //
analyzed: de'i ni gdon mi za bar rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro // mi dge ba ni lus kyi nyid //

analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni lus 'ba' zhig gi tshor ba yin no //

original: ci'i phyir sems kyi ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems kyi ma yin zhe na /

original: de'i rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yin la /

analyzed: sems kyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni yid mi bde ba yin te /

analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes de ni bshad zin to //

original: sems can rnams kyi sems smyon bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems smyon bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /

original: sems ni gang zhig yin rgyu ni ci zhig gis 'gyur zhe na /üîΩsmyo ba'i sems ni yid sems so //
analyzed: sems ni gang zhig yin rgyu ni ci zhig gis 'gyur zhe na / smyo ba'i sems ni yid sems so //
translated: What is the nature of the mind that is disturbed?üîΩThe disturbed mind is the mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: de yang rnam par smin pa las skyes / smyo ba'i sems de ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin ba las skyes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It arises from the ripening of the seeds of action.üîΩThe disturbed mind arises from the ripening of the seeds of action of sentient beings.

original: sla gnod ma nyams mya ngan gyis //
analyzed: sla gnod ma nyams mya ngan gyis //
translated: The disturbed mind is produced by the following causes:

original: de la skrag pas ni mi ma yin pa gzugs mi sdug pa mthong ba las so //üîΩgnod pas ni de nyid 'khrugs @174a * //
analyzed: de la skrag pas ni mi ma yin pa gzugs mi sdug pa mthong ba las so // gnod pas ni de nyid 'khrugs @174a * //

original: nas gnad du snun par byed pa'o //üîΩ'byung ba chen po mnyam pa las so //
analyzed: nas gnad du snun par byed pa'o // 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa las so //
translated: 2. harm, from being struck at vital points by those nonhuman beings;üîΩ3. the humors of the body being in disequilibrium;

original: mya ngan gyis ni sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pas kun nas bslang ba ste /
analyzed: mya ngan gyis ni sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pas kun nas bslang ba ste /
translated: 4. grief, from separation from loved ones.

original: rgyu de dag gis sems smyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de dag gis sems smyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These are the causes of the disturbed mind.

original: sems can gang dag gi sems smyo bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sems can gang dag gi sems smyo bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In which realms and destinies is the disturbed mind found?

original: sgra mi snyan min 'dod can rnams //
analyzed: sgra mi snyan min 'dod can rnams //
translated: It is found in the three realms and in all the five destinies.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni /

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase, ‚ÄúThey exist in the desire realm.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyang ma gtogs zhes bya bar la bskang bar bya'o //üîΩyang mdo las yon po gsum du gsungs pa ni lus kyi yon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyang ma gtogs zhes bya bar la bskang bar bya'o // yang mdo las yon po gsum du gsungs pa ni lus kyi yon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúexcept for the Buddhas‚Äù should be supplied.üîΩThe S≈´tra mentions three kinds of crookedness, three kinds of faults, and three kinds of dregs.

original: skyon gsum ni lus kyi skyon la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyon gsum ni lus kyi skyon la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of crookedness are crookedness of body, speech, and mind.üîΩThe three kinds of faults are faults of body, speech, and mind.

original: snyigs ma gsum ni lus kyi snyigs ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snyigs ma gsum ni lus kyi snyigs ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of dregs are dregs of body, speech, and mind.üîΩThe three kinds of crookedness, faults, and dregs

original: de dag kyang rim bzhin du /üîΩyon skyon snyigs mar gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: de dag kyang rim bzhin du / yon skyon snyigs mar gsungs pa ni //
translated: are, respectively,

original: g-yo dang zhe sdang 'dod chags skyes //
analyzed: g-yo dang zhe sdang 'dod chags skyes //
translated: arisen from deceit, hatred, and desire.

original: rim bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rim bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: You should understand that the three kinds of crookedness, faults, and dregs are, respectively,üîΩarisen from deceit, hatred, and desire.

original: lus kyi las g-yo las skyes pa ni gya gyu dang mthun pa'i phyir lus kyi yon po zhes bshad de /
analyzed: lus kyi las g-yo las skyes pa ni gya gyu dang mthun pa'i phyir lus kyi yon po zhes bshad de /
translated: Crookedness of body is explained as arisen from deceit because it is in accord with deceit.

original: ngag dang yid kyi yon po yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi yon po yang de bzhin no //
translated: Crookedness of speech and mind are also like that.

original: lus kyi las zhe sdang las skyes pa ni sems sdang ba dang mthun pa'i phyir lus kyi skyon zhes bshad de /
analyzed: lus kyi las zhe sdang las skyes pa ni sems sdang ba dang mthun pa'i phyir lus kyi skyon zhes bshad de /

analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi skyon yang de bzhin no // lus kyi las 'dod chags las skyes pa ni /
translated: The faults of speech and mind are similar.

original: chags pa dang mthun pa'i phyir lus kyi snyigs ma zhes bshad de /
analyzed: chags pa dang mthun pa'i phyir lus kyi snyigs ma zhes bshad de /

original: ngag dang yid kyi snyigs ma yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi snyigs ma yang de bzhin no //
translated: The dross of speech and mind are similar.

original: dkar gnag la sogs dbye ba las //
analyzed: dkar gnag la sogs dbye ba las //

original: las ni rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: las ni rnam pa bzhi yin no //

analyzed: gnag cing rnam par smin pa gnag pa'i las kyang yod / dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba'i las kyang yod /
translated: There is action that is black and has black ripening.üîΩThere is action that is white and has white ripening.

original: dkar gnag la rnam par smin pa dkar gnag pa'i las kyang yod /
analyzed: dkar gnag la rnam par smin pa dkar gnag pa'i las kyang yod /
translated: There is action that is both black and white and has black and white ripening.

analyzed: mi gnag mi dkar la rnam par smin pa mi gnag mi dkar ba'i las kyang yod de /

original: las so cog zad par byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: las so cog zad par byed par 'gyur ba'o //

original: de la / mi dge gzugs dang 'dod gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: de la / mi dge gzugs dang 'dod gtogs pa'i //

original: dge ba nyid de rim bzhin du //
analyzed: dge ba nyid de rim bzhin du //
translated: Virtue is pure, and so on.

original: gnag dang dkar dang gnyi ga'i las //
analyzed: gnag dang dkar dang gnyi ga'i las //
translated: Black, white, and mixed karma.

original: de zad byed phyir zag pa med //üîΩmi dge ba'i las ni nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir gcig tu gnag pa'o //
analyzed: de zad byed phyir zag pa med // mi dge ba'i las ni nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir gcig tu gnag pa'o //
translated: It is uncontaminated because it exhausts the other three.üîΩNonvirtuous karma is black because it is defiled.

original: rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa gnag pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa gnag pa yin no //
translated: Its karmic maturation is black because it is unpleasant.

original: gzugs su gtogs pa'i dge ba ni mi dge ba @174b dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir gcig tu dkar ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs su gtogs pa'i dge ba ni mi dge ba @174b dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir gcig tu dkar ba'o //
translated: Virtuous karma belonging to the form realm is white because it is not mixed with nonvirtue.

original: rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa dkar ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa dkar ba'o //
translated: Its karmic maturation is white because it is pleasant.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i dge ba ni mi dge ba dang 'dres pa'i phyir dkar gnag yin no //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i dge ba ni mi dge ba dang 'dres pa'i phyir dkar gnag yin no //
translated: Virtuous karma belonging to the desire realm is black and white because it is mixed with nonvirtue.

original: rnam par smin pa 'dres pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa dkar gnag yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa 'dres pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa dkar gnag yin no //
translated: Its karmic maturation is black and white because its maturation is mixed.

original: zag pa med pa'i las ni las gsum po 'di dag zad par bya ba dang spang bar bya ba nus pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i las ni las gsum po 'di dag zad par bya ba dang spang bar bya ba nus pa ste /
translated: Uncontaminated karma is able to exhaust and abandon the three types of karma.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir mi gnag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir mi gnag pa'o //
translated: It is not black because it is not defiled.

original: rnam par smin pa dkar po nyid med pa'i phyir mi dkar ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dkar po nyid med pa'i phyir mi dkar ba'o //
translated: It is not white because it does not have a white karmic maturation.

original: khams su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ba dang / 'jug pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: khams su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ba dang / 'jug pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not karmically unripened because it is not included in the realms and because it is not compatible with the process of karmic maturation.

original: ci zag pa med pa'i las thams cad las gsum po 'di dag thams cad zad par byed pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci zag pa med pa'i las thams cad las gsum po 'di dag thams cad zad par byed pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Do all three of these karmas exhaust all unwholesome karma?

original: smras pa / ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin te /
translated: No, they do not.üîΩHow is that?

original: ji ltar zhe na chos bzod 'dod chags bral ba yi //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na chos bzod 'dod chags bral ba yi //
translated: The twelve types of volition

original: bar chad med lam brgyad dag la //
analyzed: bar chad med lam brgyad dag la //
translated: on the eight uninterrupted paths

original: sems pa rnam pa bcu gnyis gang //
analyzed: sems pa rnam pa bcu gnyis gang //
translated: of freedom from attachment to the desire realm

original: nag po'i las de zad par byed //
analyzed: nag po'i las de zad par byed //
translated: exhaust black karma.

original: mthong ba'i lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi dag dang 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba la bar chad med pa'i lam brgyad dag tu sems pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi dag dang 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba la bar chad med pa'i lam brgyad dag tu sems pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The twelve types of volition on the four uninterrupted paths of freedom from attachment to the desire realm and the four uninterrupted paths of freedom from attachment to the eight stages of the form and formless realms are the three types of karma.

original: sems pa rnam pa bcu gnyis po de dag ni nag po'i las zad par byed pa'i las yin no //
analyzed: sems pa rnam pa bcu gnyis po de dag ni nag po'i las zad par byed pa'i las yin no //
translated: These twelve types of volition are actions that exhaust black actions.

original: dgu pa'i sems pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: dgu pa'i sems pa gang yin pa //
translated: The ninth volition

original: de ni dkar gnag zad byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dkar gnag zad byed pa'o //
translated: exhausts black-and-white actions.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la bar chad med pa'i lam dgu pa dag tu sems pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i las dang mi dge ba nag po'i las te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la bar chad med pa'i lam dgu pa dag tu sems pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i las dang mi dge ba nag po'i las te /
translated: The volition that occurs on the ninth uninterrupted path of the stage of the path of cultivation that is free from attachment to the desire realm is the action that exhausts black-and-white actions.

original: dkar gnag rnam pa dgu pa spong bar byed pa yin no //üîΩdkar po bsam gtan chags bral bar //
analyzed: dkar gnag rnam pa dgu pa spong bar byed pa yin no // dkar po bsam gtan chags bral bar //
translated: It abandons the ninth type of action that is black-and-white.üîΩThe volition that arises

original: bar chad med lam las skyes pa //
analyzed: bar chad med lam las skyes pa //
translated: on the last uninterrupted path

original: bsam gtan nas bsam gtan du 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa na /üîΩbar chad med pa'i lam dgu pa tha ma gang yin pa der sems pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan nas bsam gtan du 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa na / bar chad med pa'i lam dgu pa tha ma gang yin pa der sems pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: of the detachment from the absorptions is white.

original: sems pa rnam pa de bzhi ni dkar po'i las spong par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems pa rnam pa de bzhi ni dkar po'i las spong par byed pa yin no //
translated: The volition that arises on the last uninterrupted path of the stage of the path of cultivation that is free from attachment to the absorptions is the action that exhausts white actions.üîΩIt abandons the white action.üîΩThe other is known as the action

original: gzhan ni dmyal ba myong 'gyur dang / 'dod gzhan myong 'gyur gnyis su rigs //
analyzed: gzhan ni dmyal ba myong 'gyur dang / 'dod gzhan myong 'gyur gnyis su rigs //
translated: to be experienced in hell and the action to be experienced in other desire realms.

original: yang slob dpon gzhan dag ni dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / dmyal ba las gzhan pa 'dod pa'i khams su myong bar 'gyur pa'i las ni rim bzhin du nag po dang dkar gnag yin te /
analyzed: yang slob dpon gzhan dag ni dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / dmyal ba las gzhan pa 'dod pa'i khams su myong bar 'gyur pa'i las ni rim bzhin du nag po dang dkar gnag yin te /
translated: Other masters say: Karma to be experienced in hell and karma to be experienced in the desire realm other than hell are, respectively, black and black-white.

original: dmyal ba dag ni mi dge ba'i las 'ba' zhig gi @175a * //üîΩrnam par smin pa yin bas na /
analyzed: dmyal ba dag ni mi dge ba'i las 'ba' zhig gi @175a * // rnam par smin pa yin bas na /
translated: Hell is the karmic maturation of only nonvirtuous karma.

original: dper de myong bar 'gyur pa ni nag po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper de myong bar 'gyur pa ni nag po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, karma to be experienced there is called black.

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams dag na ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams dag na ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yin pas na /
translated: In the desire realm other than hell, virtuous and nonvirtuous karma exist.

original: des na de myong bar 'gyur ba ni dkar gnag ces bya'o zhes zer ro //üîΩgzhan ni mthong bas spang bya gnag /
analyzed: des na de myong bar 'gyur ba ni dkar gnag ces bya'o zhes zer ro // gzhan ni mthong bas spang bya gnag /
translated: Therefore, karma to be experienced there is called black-white.üîΩOther say: Black is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gzhan dag na re mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni dge ba dang ma 'dres ba'i phyir nag po yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni dge ba dang ma 'dres ba'i phyir nag po yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Other masters say: Black is virtuous karma to be abandoned by the path of seeing because it is not mixed with nonvirtue.

original: 'dod pa las skyes gzhan dkar gnag /'dod pa na spyod pa'i las gzhan ni dkar gnag yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa las skyes gzhan dkar gnag /'dod pa na spyod pa'i las gzhan ni dkar gnag yin no //
translated: Other actions of the realm of desire are black-white.

original: de las gzhan pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What are the other actions?

original: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba ste /
translated: They are the actions to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin no //
translated: They are wholesome and unwholesome.

original: mdo las thub pa'i gsum ste /
analyzed: mdo las thub pa'i gsum ste /
translated: The S≈´tra says that there are three silences:

original: thub pa'i lus dang / thub pa'i ngag dang / thub pa'i yid do zhes gsungs pa de la /üîΩmi slob lus ngag las yid nyid /üîΩthub pa gsum de go rims bzhin /
analyzed: thub pa'i lus dang / thub pa'i ngag dang / thub pa'i yid do zhes gsungs pa de la / mi slob lus ngag las yid nyid / thub pa gsum de go rims bzhin /
translated: the silence of the body, the silence of speech, and the silence of the mind.

original: mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag gi las dag ni thub pa'i lus dang ngag yin no //üîΩmi slob pa'i yid nyid yid kyi thub pa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag gi las dag ni thub pa'i lus dang ngag yin no // mi slob pa'i yid nyid yid kyi thub pa ste /
translated: The silence of the body and the silence of speech are the actions of the body and the actions of speech of the perfected being.

original: yid kyi las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi las ni ma yin no //
translated: The silence of the mind is the mind of the perfected being, but not the action of the mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems ni don dam par thub pa yin la /üîΩde ni lus dang ngag gnyis kyi sgo nas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems ni don dam par thub pa yin la / de ni lus dang ngag gnyis kyi sgo nas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: The mind is the ultimate silence.üîΩIt is inferred from the body and speech.

original: gzhan yang spong ba'i don gyis thub pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang spong ba'i don gyis thub pa ste /
translated: Moreover, silence is the abandonment of the body and speech.

original: lus dang ngag gi las dag ni spong ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las dag ni spong ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The actions of body and speech are by nature abstention.

original: sems la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med pa'i phyir yid kyi las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med pa'i phyir yid kyi las ni ma yin te /
translated: The action of thought is not, because thought is not informative.

original: de'i phyir yid kyis spong ba yin pas thub pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyis spong ba yin pas thub pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, the Muni is so called because he is restrained by thought.

original: ci'i phyir mi slob pa 'ba' zhig yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi slob pa 'ba' zhig yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the Muni only the adept and not others?

original: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i brjod pa thams cad med pas don dam par thub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i brjod pa thams cad med pas don dam par thub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Arhat is the Muni in the absolute sense, because he has destroyed all the defilements and the expressions of the defilements.

original: mdo las gtsang ma'i gsum gsungs pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las gtsang ma'i gsum gsungs pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three purities taught in the Sutra?

original: de dag kyang /üîΩgtsang ma rnam gsum thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de dag kyang / gtsang ma rnam gsum thams cad kyi //
translated: They are

original: legs par spyad pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa gsum yin no //
translated: The three good practices are the three purities.

original: thams cad ni lus kyi legs par spyad pa ni gtsang ma'i lus yin no //
analyzed: thams cad ni lus kyi legs par spyad pa ni gtsang ma'i lus yin no //
translated: The good practice of the body is the purity of the body.

original: thams cad kyi ngag dang yid kyi legs par spyad pa ni gtsang ma'i ngag dang yid yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi ngag dang yid kyi legs par spyad pa ni gtsang ma'i ngag dang yid yin te /
translated: The good practice of speech is the purity of speech. The good practice of thought is the purity of thought.

original: dus de srid dam /
analyzed: dus de srid dam /
translated: For how long is one a Muni?

original: gtan du nyes par spyad pa'i dri ma spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan du nyes par spyad pa'i dri ma spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it eliminates the stain of bad conduct forever.

original: de ltar bstan pa ni log pa'i thub pa dang gtsang sbra la mos pa rnams las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa ni log pa'i thub pa dang gtsang sbra la mos pa rnams las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This teaching is for the purpose of distinguishing those who are devoted to false asceticism and purity.

original: nyes par spyad pa gsum la /
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa gsum la /
translated: There are three kinds of bad conduct.

original: de la / lus kyi las stsogs mi dge ba //
analyzed: de la / lus kyi las stsogs mi dge ba //
translated: Bad conduct of body, etc.

original: nyes @175b par spyad ba gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: nyes @175b par spyad ba gsum du 'dod //
translated: are considered the three kinds of bad conduct.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mi dge ba ni rim bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyad pa'o //üîΩbrnab sems la sogs las ming yang //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mi dge ba ni rim bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyad pa'o // brnab sems la sogs las ming yang //
translated: Unwholesome actions of body, speech, and mind are, respectively, bad conduct of body, speech, and mind.üîΩCovetousness, malice, and false views

original: yid kyi nyis spyad rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: yid kyi nyis spyad rnam gsum mo //
translated: are the three kinds of bad conduct of mind.

original: las kyi rang bzhin ma yin yang yid kyi nyes par spyad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /üîΩsems pa las don gzhan du gyur pa /
analyzed: las kyi rang bzhin ma yin yang yid kyi nyes par spyad pa rnam pa gsum yod de / sems pa las don gzhan du gyur pa /
translated: Although they are not by nature action, there are three kinds of bad conduct of mind:

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //üîΩbzlog pa legs par spyad pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o // bzlog pa legs par spyad pa'o //
translated: covetousness, malice, and false views, which are different from intention.üîΩThe opposite of these is good conduct.

original: nyes par spyad pa las bzlog pa ni legs par spyad par 'dod de /
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa las bzlog pa ni legs par spyad par 'dod de /
translated: Good conduct is considered the opposite of bad conduct.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba dang / brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba rnams so //üîΩde las che long bsdus nas ni //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba dang / brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba rnams so // de las che long bsdus nas ni //
translated: virtuous actions of body, speech and mind, absence of covetousness, absence of malice and right view.

original: las kyi lam ni bcur gsungs te //
analyzed: las kyi lam ni bcur gsungs te //
translated: The ten paths of action are proclaimedüîΩon the basis of a broad division of the ten actionsüîΩof body and speech.

original: dge dang mi dge ci rigs par nyes par spyad pa dang legs par spyad pa de dag nyid las che long bsdus te /
analyzed: dge dang mi dge ci rigs par nyes par spyad pa dang legs par spyad pa de dag nyid las che long bsdus te /
translated: The ten paths of action are proclaimed on the basis of a broad division of the ten actions of body and speech, whether virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: mdo las las kyi lam bcur gsungs ba ni /
analyzed: mdo las las kyi lam bcur gsungs ba ni /
translated: The ten paths of action are virtuous or nonvirtuous

original: ci rigs par legs par spyad pa las ni dge ba rnams so //üîΩnyes par spyad pa'i las ni mi dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: ci rigs par legs par spyad pa las ni dge ba rnams so // nyes par spyad pa'i las ni mi dge ba rnams so //
translated: according to whether they are good or bad conduct.

original: las kyi lam de rnams las /
analyzed: las kyi lam de rnams las /
translated: The ten paths of action are virtuous or nonvirtuous according to whether they are good or bad conduct.

original: mi dge drug ni rnam rig min //
analyzed: mi dge drug ni rnam rig min //
translated: Six nonvirtuous actions are nonindicative states.

original: mi dge ba'i las drug po srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa rnams ni gzhan gyis byed du bcug na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las drug po srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa rnams ni gzhan gyis byed du bcug na /
translated: The six nonvirtuous actions of killing, taking what is not given, lying, slander, harsh words and idle speech are nonindicative form when one causes another to commit them.

original: dngos kyi rnam par rig byed med pa'i phyir gdon ma zos par rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos kyi rnam par rig byed med pa'i phyir gdon ma zos par rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: because there is no actual informative form.

original: gcig rnam gnyis te /
analyzed: gcig rnam gnyis te /
translated: One is of two types.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa de ni bdag nyid kyis mthar phyin par byed pa'i phyir rtag tu rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa de ni bdag nyid kyis mthar phyin par byed pa'i phyir rtag tu rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Sexual misconduct is always of the nature of both informative and non-informative form, because one brings it to completion oneself.

original: de gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa ni de 'dra bar dga' bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa ni de 'dra bar dga' bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: One does not enjoy it when another makes one do it.

original: de dag kyang byed na /
analyzed: de dag kyang byed na /
translated: If one makes another do it,

original: las kyi lam drug po de dag kyang bdag nyid byed pa na ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: las kyi lam drug po de dag kyang bdag nyid byed pa na ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: then when one oneself performs these six karmic paths, the non-informative form is of two types.

original: srog gcod pa dus de nyid du shin rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dus de nyid du shin rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: If the life is killed at that time, it is of two types.

original: phyis shi na ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'ba' zhig yin no //üîΩdge ba'i las kyi lam rnams las //
analyzed: phyis shi na ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'ba' zhig yin no // dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams las //
translated: If it dies later, it is only non-informative form.üîΩThe seven virtuous karmic paths

original: dge ba bdun rnam gnyis /
analyzed: dge ba bdun rnam gnyis /
translated: are of two types.

original: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims ni rnam par @176a * //üîΩrig byed la rag lus pa'i phyir gzugs can bdun gyi las kyi lam rnams ni /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims ni rnam par @176a * // rig byed la rag lus pa'i phyir gzugs can bdun gyi las kyi lam rnams ni /
translated: The morality of accepting vows is form, because it depends on informative form.

original: nges par rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam pa gnyig yin no //
analyzed: nges par rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam pa gnyig yin no //
translated: The seven types of karmic paths that are form are definitely both informative and non-informative form.

original: ting 'dzin las skyes rnam rig min //
analyzed: ting 'dzin las skyes rnam rig min //
translated: The others arise from concentration.

original: bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'i sdom pa ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'i sdom pa ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The vows subsumed by the absorptions and uncontaminated vows are called arisen from concentration.

original: de dag ni sems tsam la rag lus pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid do //üîΩnye bar bsdogs la rnam rig byed //
analyzed: de dag ni sems tsam la rag lus pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid do // nye bar bsdogs la rnam rig byed //
translated: They are only non-informative form because they depend on the mind alone.üîΩThe preparatory stages are informative.

original: las kyi lam nyer bsdogs la ni gdon mi za bar rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: las kyi lam nyer bsdogs la ni gdon mi za bar rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: The karmic paths of the preparatory stages are definitely only informative form.

original: rnam par rig byed min pa des //üîΩgal te kun nas dkris pa drag po'am /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed min pa des // gal te kun nas dkris pa drag po'am /
translated: That non-informative formüîΩIf one engages in the preparatory stages with strong entanglements

original: dang ba lhur len pa chen pos sbyor ba rtsom na ni //
