original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is severed by all nine types of roots of virtue simultaneously, like objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: Some say:

original: rim gyis zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rim gyis zhes brjod de /
translated: It is severed gradually.

original: log par lta ba rnam pa dgus dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa dgu gcod par byed de /
analyzed: log par lta ba rnam pa dgus dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa dgu gcod par byed de /
translated: The nine types of wrong view sever the nine types of roots of virtue.

original: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba bzhin du chen pos chung du gcod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba bzhin du chen pos chung du gcod do zhes zer ro //
translated: The great sever the small, like objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: gang du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams gcod ce na /
analyzed: gang du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams gcod ce na /
translated: Where is the root of the wholesome cut?

original: mi'i nang du /
analyzed: mi'i nang du /
translated: In the human realm.

original: mi'i nang 'ba' zhig tu yin gyi ngan song dag na ni med de /
analyzed: mi'i nang 'ba' zhig tu yin gyi ngan song dag na ni med de /
translated: It is only in the human realm that the root of the wholesome is cut, not in the unfortunate planes of existence,

original: de shes rab nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa gnyi ga yang mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de shes rab nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa gnyi ga yang mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the wisdom that is defiled and the wisdom that is not defiled are both unstable there.

original: 'bras bu mngon du gyur ba'i phyir lha dag gi nang na yang med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon du gyur ba'i phyir lha dag gi nang na yang med do //
translated: It is also not in the celestial realm, because the effect is evident there.

original: gling gsum dag na yang byang gi sgra mi snyan dag na yang med de /
analyzed: gling gsum dag na yang byang gi sgra mi snyan dag na yang med de /
translated: It is also not in the northern continent Kuru,

original: sdig pa'i bsam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde dag kyang /
analyzed: sdig pa'i bsam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // de dag kyang /
translated: because there is no intention to do evil there.üîΩAnd these people and women

original: skyes pa bud med rnams kyi 'chad //
analyzed: skyes pa bud med rnams kyi 'chad //
translated: cut the root of the wholesome.

original: de dag las kyang sred pa spyod pa dag gi 'chad pa med de /
analyzed: de dag las kyang sred pa spyod pa dag gi 'chad pa med de /
translated: It is not cut by those who practice craving,

original: bsam pa g-yo ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa g-yo ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their intention is unstable.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: lta spyad / bsam pa brtan pa dang mkhyud pa'i bsam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta spyad / bsam pa brtan pa dang mkhyud pa'i bsam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the intention of those whose view and practice are firm and whose intention is closed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma ni da la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma ni da la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: For this very reason, a mother, a father, and so on are not the root of the wholesome,üîΩbecause their intention is unstable.

original: sred pa spyod pa'i phyogs can yin pa'i phyir ba dang / ngan song ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sred pa spyod pa'i phyogs can yin pa'i phyir ba dang / ngan song ba bzhin no //
translated: because it is the side of craving, like the bad destinies.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par 'chad pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig yin zhe ma de dang mi ldan pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par 'chad pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig yin zhe ma de dang mi ldan pa /
translated: What is the nature of the cutting off of the wholesome roots?

original: gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi thob pa yang mi skye la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi thob pa yang mi skye la /
translated: When the acquisition of the wholesome roots is not produced,

original: ma thob pa yang skye ba ste /
analyzed: ma thob pa yang skye ba ste /
translated: and when the non-acquisition is produced,

original: mi ldan pa skyes pa der dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yang dag par chad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi ldan pa skyes pa der dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yang dag par chad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: then the wholesome roots are said to be cut off.

original: de dag gi yang bar chad pa rnams ji ltar na yang nyid mtshams sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi yang bar chad pa rnams ji ltar na yang nyid mtshams sbyor zhe na /
translated: How can one who has cut off the wholesome roots take up the wholesome roots again?

original: mtshams ni the tshom yod lta bas //
analyzed: mtshams ni the tshom yod lta bas //
translated: The wholesome roots are taken up again through doubt and view.

original: nam zhig 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu la the tshom skyes @180a * //üîΩpa'am yang dag par lta ba zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: nam zhig 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu la the tshom skyes @180a * //üîΩpa'am yang dag par lta ba zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: When doubt and the view of the existence of the self arise in him, then the wholesome roots are taken up again.

original: yod par lta ba skyes pa'i tshe yang de'i thob pa skyes pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi nyid mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yod par lta ba skyes pa'i tshe yang de'i thob pa skyes pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi nyid mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When the view of existence arises, the possession of this view arises and one says that the wholesome roots are ‚Äúreconnected.

original: nying mtshams ni rnam pa dgu cig car du sbyor la /
analyzed: nying mtshams ni rnam pa dgu cig car du sbyor la /
translated: ‚Äù The reconnection of the wholesome roots takes place all at once, in nine stages.

original: mngon sum du ni rim gyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum du ni rim gyis 'gyur te /
translated: But their actualization takes place gradually,

original: nad med na stobs rnyed par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nad med na stobs rnyed par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: like the acquisition of strength by one who is recovering from an illness.üîΩThe reconnection of the wholesome roots does not take place

original: yang de dag gi nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni /üîΩmtshams med byed pas 'di la min //
analyzed: yang de dag gi nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni / mtshams med byed pas 'di la min //
translated: for those who commit transgressions having a similar effect to the crimes with an immediately successive retribution.

original: mtshams med pa byed pa rnams na ni ma yin gyi gzhan gyi ni 'di nyid la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed pa rnams na ni ma yin gyi gzhan gyi ni 'di nyid la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not take place for those who commit the five crimes with an immediately successive retribution, but it does take place for others.

original: 'di ni las kyi skabs yin pas //
analyzed: 'di ni las kyi skabs yin pas //
translated: We have spoken of the wholesome roots.

original: de la las kyi lam du zhig dang sems ba lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la las kyi lam du zhig dang sems ba lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: How many paths of action can arise simultaneously with intention?

original: mi dge brgyad kyi bar dag dang // sems pa lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi dge brgyad kyi bar dag dang // sems pa lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Eight wholesome courses of action can be simultaneous with intention.

original: re zhig gcig dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni gzhan med par brnab sems la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa'am //
analyzed: re zhig gcig dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni gzhan med par brnab sems la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa'am //
translated: First, when one occurs simultaneously with one, it is when covetousness, etc. manifest without the others,

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems yin la /
translated: or when the mind is not defiled.

original: de'i sbyor bas gzugs can rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig gis mthar phyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sbyor bas gzugs can rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig gis mthar phyin par byed pa'o //
translated: When one is completed by any of the physical actions through the preparation of that, it occurs simultaneously with one.

original: gnyis dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni //üîΩgnod sems skyes pa'i sems kyis srog gcod pa'am /üîΩbrnab sems skyes pas ma byin par len pa'am /
analyzed: gnyis dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni // gnod sems skyes pa'i sems kyis srog gcod pa'am / brnab sems skyes pas ma byin par len pa'am /
translated: When two occur simultaneously,üîΩit is when one kills with a mind of malice,üîΩor when one steals through covetousness,

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'am /
translated: or when one engages in sexual misconduct through lust,

original: tshig kyal pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: tshig kyal pa smra ba'o //
translated: or when one speaks frivolously.

original: gsum dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni gnod sems skyes pa'i sems kyis dus gcig tu gzhan gyi srog gcod cing rku na'o //
analyzed: gsum dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni gnod sems skyes pa'i sems kyis dus gcig tu gzhan gyi srog gcod cing rku na'o //
translated: When three occur simultaneously, it is when one kills and steals another's life at the same time with a mind of malice.

original: brnab sems skyes la de'i sbyor bas gzugs can gnyis kyis mthar phyin par byed na yang gsum nyid dang ngo //
analyzed: brnab sems skyes la de'i sbyor bas gzugs can gnyis kyis mthar phyin par byed na yang gsum nyid dang ngo //
translated: When covetousness arises and one completes it with two physical actions through its preparation, it is also just three.

original: bzhi dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba ni brnab sems la sogs par 'gyur la de'i sbyor bas gzhan gsum gyis mthar phyin par byed na ste /
analyzed: bzhi dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba ni brnab sems la sogs par 'gyur la de'i sbyor bas gzhan gsum gyis mthar phyin par byed na ste /
translated: Four arising simultaneously with intention would be covetousness and so on, and if one completes the three roots of nonvirtue through their preparation.

original: de bzhin du lda dang drug dang bdun dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lda dang drug dang bdun dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Six, seven and eight should be applied in the same way.

original: brgyad dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba ni brnab sems la sogs par gyur ba nyid kyis drug mi sbyor ba byas la //
analyzed: brgyad dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba ni brnab sems la sogs par gyur ba nyid kyis drug mi sbyor ba byas la //
translated: Eight arising simultaneously with intention would be covetousness and so on, not applying the six.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa bdag nyid kyis byed cing bdag nyid kyis mthar phyin par byed na'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa bdag nyid kyis byed cing bdag nyid kyis mthar phyin par byed na'o //
translated: If one engages in sexual misconduct oneself and completes it oneself.

original: re zhig mi dge ba dag dang ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig mi dge ba dag dang ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: That is how nonvirtue is.üîΩUp to ten virtuous paths of action arise simultaneously with intention.

original: dge ba bcu yi bar dag dang // dge ba'i las kyi lam dag dang ni bcu'i bar dang sems pa lhan cig tu 'byung ngo zhes spyir bstan nas dmigs kyis ston par byed de /
analyzed: dge ba bcu yi bar dag dang // dge ba'i las kyi lam dag dang ni bcu'i bar dang sems pa lhan cig tu 'byung ngo zhes spyir bstan nas dmigs kyis ston par byed de /
translated: In general, it is taught that up to ten virtuous karmic paths arise simultaneously with intention.

original: gcig dang lnga dang brgyad dang min //
analyzed: gcig dang lnga dang brgyad dang min //
translated: One, five and eight do not.

original: @180b de la las kyi lam gnyis dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: @180b de la las kyi lam gnyis dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa'o //
translated: The wholesome action of the five consciousnesses is present with two paths of action.

original: gsum dang ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //üîΩbzhi dang ni mi dge ba'am /
analyzed: gsum dang ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o // bzhi dang ni mi dge ba'am /
translated: The wholesome action of mental consciousness is present with three paths of action when it is associated with right view.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis dge sbyong ngam dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa yang dag par len na'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis dge sbyong ngam dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa yang dag par len na'o //
translated: The wholesome action of mental consciousness is present with four paths of action when one who is in a non-virtuous or neutral mind takes up the vows of a renunciate or a layperson.

original: drug dang ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa de nyid yang dag par len na'o //üîΩbdun dang ni dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas te /üîΩde nyid yang dag gnod pa dang // mi dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len na'o //
analyzed: drug dang ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa de nyid yang dag par len na'o // bdun dang ni dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas te / de nyid yang dag gnod pa dang // mi dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len na'o //
translated: The wholesome action of the five consciousnesses is present with six paths of action when one who is in a virtuous mind takes up those vows.üîΩThe wholesome action of mental consciousness is present with seven paths of action when one who is in a virtuous mind takes up the vows of a fully ordained monk.

original: dgu dang ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lda'am /
analyzed: dgu dang ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lda'am /
translated: The wholesome action of mental consciousness is present with nine paths of action when one who is in a non-virtuous or neutral mind takes up the vows of a fully ordained monk.üîΩThe wholesome action of mental consciousness is present with ten paths of action when one who is in a virtuous mind takes up the vows of a fully ordained monk.

original: zad la mi skye ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas te de nyid yang dag par len na'o //
analyzed: zad la mi skye ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas te de nyid yang dag par len na'o //
translated: The person who is in the process of taking up the pure prƒÅtimok·π£a restraint, i.e., the restraint of the bhik·π£u or bhik·π£u·πáƒ´, is in the process of abandoning the action of killing, etc., and is in the process of acquiring non-action.

original: bcu dang ni de las gzhan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas te dge slong gi sdom pa nyid yang dag par len na'o //üîΩ'gro ba gang dag na dge ba'am /
analyzed: bcu dang ni de las gzhan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas te dge slong gi sdom pa nyid yang dag par len na'o // 'gro ba gang dag na dge ba'am /
translated: The person who is in the process of taking up the pure restraint of the dhyƒÅna or the pure restraint, is in the process of abandoning the action of killing, etc., and is in the process of acquiring non-action.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam du zhig mngon sum du gyur pa'am ldan pa'i sgo nas yod ce na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam du zhig mngon sum du gyur pa'am ldan pa'i sgo nas yod ce na /
translated: In which planes of existence are the good and bad paths of action present, either in actual fact or by possession?

original: dmyal ba dag na kyal ba dang // tshig rtsub gnod sems rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: dmyal ba dag na kyal ba dang // tshig rtsub gnod sems rnam gnyis so //
translated: In hell, idle chatter, injurious speech and malice are twofold.

original: dmyal bdag na ni las kyi lam 'di gsum mngon sum du gyur pa dang ldan pa'i sgo dang rnam pa gnyi gnas yod de /üîΩsmre sngags 'don pa'i phyir na tshig kyal pa yin no //
analyzed: dmyal bdag na ni las kyi lam 'di gsum mngon sum du gyur pa dang ldan pa'i sgo dang rnam pa gnyi gnas yod de / smre sngags 'don pa'i phyir na tshig kyal pa yin no //
translated: In hell, these three paths of action are present in two ways, i.e., by actual fact and by possession:üîΩbecause of the lamentation of the damned;

original: phan tshun spyo bar byed pa'i phyir na tshug rtsub po yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun spyo bar byed pa'i phyir na tshug rtsub po yin no //
translated: because of mutual hatred.

original: gcig la gcig sems kyi rgyud rtsub pos zhe sdang ba'i phyir na gnod sems yin no //
analyzed: gcig la gcig sems kyi rgyud rtsub pos zhe sdang ba'i phyir na gnod sems yin no //
translated: They are ill-will because they are hostile to one another through the coarseness of their thoughts.

original: brnab sems dang log lta ldan pas so //
analyzed: brnab sems dang log lta ldan pas so //
translated: They are associated with covetousness and false view.

original: chags par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ba dang / las mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas ni med do //
analyzed: chags par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ba dang / las mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas ni med do //
translated: They are not associated with sensual desire and malice, because there is no object of sensual desire and because they are manifest in their action.

original: las zad nas 'chi ba'i phyir ba dang / rdzas dang bud med yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dag med do //
analyzed: las zad nas 'chi ba'i phyir ba dang / rdzas dang bud med yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dag med do //
translated: They are not associated with killing, stealing, and adultery, because one dies when one's action is exhausted, because there is no appropriation of property or women, and because there is no need for it.

original: dgos ba med pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba med do //
analyzed: dgos ba med pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba med do //
translated: They are not associated with lying, because there is no need for it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ba dang / rtag tu bye zin pa'i phyir phra ma med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ba dang / rtag tu bye zin pa'i phyir phra ma med do //
translated: They are not associated with slander, because they are always separated.

original: sgra mi snyan na gsum yin no //
analyzed: sgra mi snyan na gsum yin no //
translated: In Kuru, there are three.

original: brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba ste /
analyzed: brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba ste /
translated: There are three courses of action in Kuru in the north: covetousness, malice, and false view.

original: mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin gyi ldan pa'i sgo nas zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin gyi ldan pa'i sgo nas zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: They are not manifest, but they are associated.

original: nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ba dang / @181a * //
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ba dang / @181a * //
translated: because they do not grasp anything as mine;

original: kun du gnod pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir pa dang / sdig pa'i bsam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du gnod pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir pa dang / sdig pa'i bsam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no basis for harming others; and because they have no evil thoughts.

original: der ni bdun pa dngos su yang //
analyzed: der ni bdun pa dngos su yang //
translated: The seventh is also actually present there.

original: de ni tshig kyal pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang yod do //
analyzed: de ni tshig kyal pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang yod do //
translated: Idle chatter is also actually present there.

original: de dag ni res 'ga' nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis glu dag kyang len to //
analyzed: de dag ni res 'ga' nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis glu dag kyang len to //
translated: Sometimes they sing songs with a defiled mind.

original: sdig pa'i bsam pa yin pa'i phyir ba dang / tshe nges pa dang rdzas dang bud med yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir ba dang / dgos pa med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: sdig pa'i bsam pa yin pa'i phyir ba dang / tshe nges pa dang rdzas dang bud med yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir ba dang / dgos pa med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa la sogs pa med do //
translated: Killing and so on are absent there because they have no evil thoughts, because they have no fixed life span, because they have no possessions or women, and because they have no need for them.

original: 'dod pa gzhan na mi dge bcu //
analyzed: 'dod pa gzhan na mi dge bcu //
translated: The ten nonvirtues exist in the other desire realms.

original: dngos su yang zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: dngos su yang zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Also actually present should be supplied.

original: dmyal ba dang sgra mi snyan las gzhan pa 'dod pa'i khams dag na ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyi mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgro nas kyang yod de /
analyzed: dmyal ba dang sgra mi snyan las gzhan pa 'dod pa'i khams dag na ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyi mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgro nas kyang yod de /
translated: In the realm of desire, with the exception of the hells and the realm of the gods, the ten paths of action exist through the fact of being present and through the fact of being possessed.

original: dud 'gro yi dags dang lha dag gi nang na ni sdom pa ma yin pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro yi dags dang lha dag gi nang na ni sdom pa ma yin pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Among animals, hungry ghosts and gods, the paths of action are not included in the restraint of the lay practitioner.

original: mi dag gi nang na ni sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa yang yod do //
analyzed: mi dag gi nang na ni sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa yang yod do //
translated: Among humans, the paths of action are included in the restraint of the lay practitioner.

original: gal te yang lhas lha mi gsod kyang 'gro ba gzhan na gnas pa ni gsod par byed do //
analyzed: gal te yang lhas lha mi gsod kyang 'gro ba gzhan na gnas pa ni gsod par byed do //
translated: Even though a god does not kill a god, he kills beings of other destinies.

original: gzhan dag na re lha yang mgo dang rked pa bcad na 'chi'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lha yang mgo dang rked pa bcad na 'chi'o zhes zer ro //
translated: According to other masters, the god also dies when his head or his body is cut.

original: mi dge ba rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained the unwholesome paths of action.

original: dge ba gsum ni thams cad na //üîΩrnyed dang mngon du gyur sgo nas //
analyzed: dge ba gsum ni thams cad na //üîΩrnyed dang mngon du gyur sgo nas //
translated: The wholesome ones exist everywhere.üîΩThe wholesome paths of action exist in all the realms of existence.

analyzed: brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba rnams ni khams gsum dang / 'gro ba lnga po thams cad na yang mngon du gyur pa dang ldan pa'i sgo nas yod do //
translated: Absence of covetousness, absence of malice and right view exist in the three realms and in the five destinies, both as actual entities and as potentiality.

original: gzugs med 'du shes med sems can /
analyzed: gzugs med 'du shes med sems can /
translated: In the formless realm and in the realm of beings devoid of discernment,

original: rnyed pa bdun te /
analyzed: rnyed pa bdun te /

analyzed: gzugs med pa dag dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dag na ni lus dang ngag gi las dge ba'i las kyi lam bdun po ldan pa'i sgo 'ba' zhig nas yod de /
translated: In the formless realm and in the realm of beings devoid of discernment, the seven wholesome paths of action of body and speech exist only as potentiality, not as actual entities.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa rnams la yang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ldan pa'i sgo nas yod la /
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa rnams la yang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ldan pa'i sgo nas yod la /
translated: The noble ones born in the formless realm possess the uncontaminated restraint of the past and future.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams la yang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa ldan pa'i sgo nas yod do //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams la yang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa ldan pa'i sgo nas yod do //
translated: The beings devoid of discernment possess the meditative discipline.

original: lhag ma ni mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang /
analyzed: lhag ma ni mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang /
translated: The rest exist as actual entities.

original: dmyal bcas sgra mi snyan ma gtogs //
analyzed: dmyal bcas sgra mi snyan ma gtogs //
translated: Except in the hells and in Uttarakuru,

analyzed: lhag mar byas pa lhag ma ste // dmyal ba dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa ma gtogs pa khams dang 'gro ba gzhan gang yin pa ste /

original: de dag ni dge ba'i las kyi lam bdun po 'di dag mngon du @181b gyur ba'i sgo nas kyang yod do //
analyzed: de dag ni dge ba'i las kyi lam bdun po 'di dag mngon du @181b gyur ba'i sgo nas kyang yod do //
translated: The other realms and other destinies, with the exception of the hells and the gods devoid of discernment, exist in the sense that the seven wholesome courses of action are manifest there.

original: de dag kyang dud 'gro dang yi dags na ni sdom pa ma gtogs la /
analyzed: de dag kyang dud 'gro dang yi dags na ni sdom pa ma gtogs la /
translated: In the animal and ghost realms, the wholesome courses of action are not included in the restraints.

original: gzugs kyi khams dag na ni sdom pas bsdus pa ma gtogs te gzhan ni gnyi ga yod do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dag na ni sdom pas bsdus pa ma gtogs te gzhan ni gnyi ga yod do //
translated: In the form realm, the wholesome courses of action are not included in the restraints.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu dang / dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu dang / dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po 'di dag ni /
translated: The ten wholesome courses of action and the ten unwholesome courses of action

original: thams cad bdag po rgyu mthun dang // rnam smin 'bras bu smin par byed //
analyzed: thams cad bdag po rgyu mthun dang // rnam smin 'bras bu smin par byed //

original: re zhig mi dge bdag gis ni kun tu bsten pa dang / sgom par byas pa dang / lan mang du byas pas ni dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig mi dge bdag gis ni kun tu bsten pa dang / sgom par byas pa dang / lan mang du byas pas ni dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /

original: 'di ni de dag gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin no //

analyzed: brgyal 'dir mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rnam par skye na yang srog gcod pas ni tshe thung dur 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is reborn in the human realm, the result of killing is a short life;

original: ma byin par len pas ni longs spyod kyis phongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byin par len pas ni longs spyod kyis phongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: the result of stealing is lack of resources;

analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni dgra dang bcas pa'i chung ma can du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: brdzun du smra bas ni skur ba mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the result of lying is much slander;

original: phra mas ni mdza' bod dang dbye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩtshig rtsub pos ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra mas ni mdza' bod dang dbye bar 'gyur ro // tshig rtsub pos ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: the result of divisive speech is the breakup of friendships;üîΩthe result of harsh speech is hearing unpleasant sounds;

original: tshig kyal pas ni tshig gzung bar mi 'os par 'gyur ro //üîΩbrnab sems kyis ni 'dod chags mi bzad bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig kyal pas ni tshig gzung bar mi 'os par 'gyur ro // brnab sems kyis ni 'dod chags mi bzad bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the result of idle chitchat is being ignored;üîΩthe result of covetousness is intense desire;

original: gnod sems kyis ni zhe sdang drag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sems kyis ni zhe sdang drag por 'gyur ro //

original: log par lta bas ni gti mug shas che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log par lta bas ni gti mug shas che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the result of wrong view is intense delusion.

original: de la ni gti mug mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni gti mug mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is much delusion there.

original: de dag ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: These are the effects of the same type.

original: srog gcod pa kun du bsten pas ni phyi'i dngos po mthu chung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩma byin par len pas ni ser ba dang rdul mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa kun du bsten pas ni phyi'i dngos po mthu chung bar 'gyur ro // ma byin par len pas ni ser ba dang rdul mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: As for the effects of the dominant power, the external world is poor and weak for one who has frequently killed.üîΩIt is full of hail and dust for one who has frequently stolen.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni rdul gyis 'khrigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni rdul gyis 'khrigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is full of dust and dirt for one who has frequently committed adultery.

original: brdzun du smra bas ni dring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdzun du smra bas ni dring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is full of deceit for one who has frequently lied.

original: phra mas ni mthon dman du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra mas ni mthon dman du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is uneven for one who has frequently slandered.

original: tshig rtsub pos ni tsha sgro can dang / dgon dung dag dang tha chad pa dang / sdig pa thams cad kyi sar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig rtsub pos ni tsha sgro can dang / dgon dung dag dang tha chad pa dang / sdig pa thams cad kyi sar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is salty, arid, and full of thorns for one who has frequently spoken harshly.

original: tshig kyal bas ni dus log par 'gyur ro //üîΩbrnab sems kyis ni 'bras bu phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig kyal bas ni dus log par 'gyur ro // brnab sems kyis ni 'bras bu phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: It is out of season for one who has frequently spoken frivolously.üîΩIts fruits are small for one who has frequently been covetous.

original: gnod sems kyis ni 'bras bu kha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sems kyis ni 'bras bu kha bar 'gyur ro //

original: log par lta bas ni 'bras bu chung du 'am 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log par lta bas ni 'bras bu chung du 'am 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //

original: 'di ni de dag gi bdag po'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi bdag po'i 'bras bu yin no //

original: ci'i phyir las kyi lam 'di dag gi 'bras bu rnam pa gsum po de dag tu mngon par 'grub ce na /üîΩre zhig @182a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir las kyi lam 'di dag gi 'bras bu rnam pa gsum po de dag tu mngon par 'grub ce na / re zhig @182a * //
translated: Why are the results of these karmic paths established as these three types?

analyzed: srog gcod pa ni gsod par byed pas na sdug bsngal bskyed pa dang / bsad pa dang / stobs med par byas pa de'i phyir /

analyzed: sdug bsngal phyir dang bsad phyir dang // stobs med byas phyir 'bras rnam gsum //

original: pha rol po sdug bsngal bar byas pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni dmyal ba dag tu sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol po sdug bsngal bar byas pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni dmyal ba dag tu sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: stobs med par byas pa'i bdag po'i 'bras bus ni phyi'i sman rnams stobs chung bar 'gyur ro //

original: byang chub dang po'i de ma thag //
analyzed: byang chub dang po'i de ma thag //
translated: completes the perfection of diligence and turns back the eon.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis yongs su rdzogs te /
translated: The vajra like samadhi perfects both the perfection of meditative stabilization and the perfection of wisdom.

original: rang rang gi phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: rang rang gi phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: They are perfections because they have gone to the other side of their own individual perfections.üîΩA sutra states:üîΩThere are three bases of meritorious action:üîΩthe basis of meritorious action arisen from giving, the basis of meritorious action arisen from ethics, and the basis of meritorious action arisen from meditation.

original: mdo las sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi dang / bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi gsum du gsungs pa ji ltar na gsum po 'di dag bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yin zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi dang / bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi gsum du gsungs pa ji ltar na gsum po 'di dag bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yin zhe na /
translated: How are these three bases of meritorious action?üîΩMeritorious action, its basis, and

original: bsod nams bya dang de gzhi dang // gsum po ji ltar las lam bzhin //
analyzed: bsod nams bya dang de gzhi dang // gsum po ji ltar las lam bzhin //

analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni ci rigs par bsod nams kyang yin pas na bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi ste /
translated: These three are meritorious action and its basis, respectively, because they are meritorious.

analyzed: dper na de dag ni las kyang yin la las kyi lam yin pa dang / las kyi lam 'ba' zhig yin bas na las kyi lam mo zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, they are action and also the path of action, or they are the path of action alone.

analyzed: de la re zhig sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi lus dang dag gi las ni rnam pa gsum char yin no //
translated: Among them, the basis of meritorious action consisting of giving is threefold: the action of body and speech,

analyzed: des kun nas bslad ba'i sems pa ni bsod nams dang bya ba yin no //
translated: the intention that instigates it is meritorious action,

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni bsod nams 'ba' zhig yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni bsod nams 'ba' zhig yin no //
translated: and the factors that are concomitant with it are merit alone.

original: tshul khrims las byung ba yang lus dang ngag gi las 'ba' zhig ni rnam pa gsum char yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba yang lus dang ngag gi las 'ba' zhig ni rnam pa gsum char yin no //
translated: The basis of meritorious action consisting of morality is threefold: the action of body and speech alone,

original: bsgoms pa las byung pa'i byams pa ni bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung pa'i byams pa ni bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yin no //

original: byams pa'i sgo nas de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa'i sgo nas de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one forms the intention that is concomitant with love.

original: de dang lhan cig byung ba'i sems pa ni tshul khrims dang bsod nams bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig byung ba'i sems pa ni tshul khrims dang bsod nams bya ba yin no //
translated: The intention that occurs with it is morality and meritorious action.

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba gzhan dag ni bsod nams 'ba' zhig yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba gzhan dag ni bsod nams 'ba' zhig yin no //
translated: The other factors that occur with it are only merit.

original: sbyin ba zhes bya ba 'di ci yin gang sbyin par bya ba @189b de yang sbyin pa yin na /
analyzed: sbyin ba zhes bya ba 'di ci yin gang sbyin par bya ba @189b de yang sbyin pa yin na /
translated: What is this giving? The object that is given is also giving.

original: 'dir ni / gang gis sbyin byed des sbyin pa //
analyzed: 'dir ni / gang gis sbyin byed des sbyin pa //
translated: Here, the giver gives by means of that.

original: 'dir ni 'jigs pa dang / lan la re ba dang chags pa la sogs pa sbyin ba ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir khyad par du bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'jigs pa dang / lan la re ba dang chags pa la sogs pa sbyin ba ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir khyad par du bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Here, giving out of fear, out of hope for reciprocity, out of attachment, etc., is not accepted. Therefore, in order to specify, it is said:

original: mchod dang phan gdags 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: mchod dang phan gdags 'dod pa yis //
translated: Out of desire to worship and to benefit.

original: gang gis gzhan dag la mchod pa dang / phan gdags par 'dod pa gnyis kyis sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis gzhan dag la mchod pa dang / phan gdags par 'dod pa gnyis kyis sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: One gives by means of the two, out of desire to worship and to benefit others.

original: gang gis sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba de gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba de gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is it by means of which one gives?

original: lus dang ngag las slong dang bcas //
analyzed: lus dang ngag las slong dang bcas //
translated: Body and speech, with the request.

original: slong ba yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: slong ba yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the request?

analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs gang gis de slong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The collection of mind and mental activities that instigates it.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone objects:

original: gang tshe skyes bu dge yid kyis //
analyzed: gang tshe skyes bu dge yid kyis //
translated: When a virtuous person

original: rang gi rdzas dag sbyin byed pa'i //üîΩde tshe dge ba'i phung po rnams //
analyzed: rang gi rdzas dag sbyin byed pa'i // de tshe dge ba'i phung po rnams //
translated: gives his own goods with a virtuous mind,üîΩat that time

analyzed: sbyin pa zhes ni brjod pa yin // zhes bya ba'i //
translated: it is called generosity of the aggregates of virtue.

original: de 'bras longs spyod chen po nyid //
analyzed: de 'bras longs spyod chen po nyid //
translated: Its result is great enjoyment.

original: sbyin pa de lta bu de yang //üîΩbdag gzhan don phyir gnyis don phyir //
analyzed: sbyin pa de lta bu de yang // bdag gzhan don phyir gnyis don phyir //
translated: This kind of generosity is practiced

original: gnyis ka'i don du min phyir sbyin //üîΩde la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'am /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i don du min phyir sbyin // de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'am /
translated: for the sake of self, for the sake of others, and for the sake of both.üîΩIt is practiced for the sake of self when one who is not free from attachment,

original: so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang ma bral ba gang zhig mchod rten la sbyin ba sbyin par byed na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang ma bral ba gang zhig mchod rten la sbyin ba sbyin par byed na /
translated: or a layperson who is not free from attachment, gives a gift to a stupa.

original: des pha rol po dag la phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir de ni de'i bdag nyid kyi don 'ba' zhig gi phyir yin no //
analyzed: des pha rol po dag la phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir de ni de'i bdag nyid kyi don 'ba' zhig gi phyir yin no //
translated: Since it does not benefit others, it is practiced solely for the sake of the self.üîΩIt is practiced for the sake of others when one gives a gift to those who are not one‚Äôs relatives,

analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral ba gang zhig sems can pha rol po dag la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na / des de dag la phan btags pa'i phyir sbyin pa de gzhan gyi don gyi phyir ni yin gyi de'i rnam par smin pa'i sa las shin tu yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ma gtogs par bdag gi don gyi phyir ni
translated: When a noble one free from attachment gives a gift to other sentient beings,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: that giving is for the benefit of others, not for his own benefit, because he is completely beyond the level of the karmic maturation of that giving.

original: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'am so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang ma bral ba gang zhig sems can pha rol po dag la sbyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'am so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang ma bral ba gang zhig sems can pha rol po dag la sbyin par byed ce na /
translated: When a noble one free from attachment or an ordinary being not free from attachment gives a gift to other sentient beings,

original: sbyin pa de gnyi ga'i don gyi phyir yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa de gnyi ga'i don gyi phyir yin no //
translated: that giving is for the benefit of both.

original: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral ba gang zhig mchod rten la sbyin ba sbyin par byed na /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral ba gang zhig mchod rten la sbyin ba sbyin par byed na /
translated: When a noble one free from attachment gives a gift to a stupa,

analyzed: sbyin ba de ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur bam gtogs par gnyi ga'i don gyi phyir yang ma yin te /
translated: That generosity is not for the sake of both, except for the experience of the present life.

original: de ni bkur sti dang byas pa gzo ba 'ba' zhig gis sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de ni bkur sti dang byas pa gzo ba 'ba' zhig gis sbyin par byed do //
translated: For that is given only through respect and gratitude.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po'o zhes bya ba ni spyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po'o zhes bya ba ni spyir bstan pa'o //
translated: The result of generosity is great wealth. This is the general teaching.üîΩIts distinctions are from the giver,

original: de yi khyad par sbyin bdag dang // dngos dang zhing gi byad par las //
analyzed: de yi khyad par sbyin bdag dang // dngos dang zhing gi byad par las //
translated: the thing given, and the field.

original: do ni re zhig /üîΩsbyin bdag khyad 'phags dad sogs kyis //
analyzed: do ni re zhig / sbyin bdag khyad 'phags dad sogs kyis //
translated: First,

original: sbyin bdag @190a * //
analyzed: sbyin bdag @190a * //
translated: the giver is distinguished by faith and so on.

analyzed: gi khyad par ni dad pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin no //

analyzed: sbyin bdag de lta bu de ni /

analyzed: gus la sogs pas sbyin par byed /

analyzed: gus pa dang / rang gi lag pa dang / dus dang / gzhan la mi gnod par sbyin par byed de /
translated: One gives with respect, with one's own hand, at the appropriate time, and without doing harm to others.üîΩTherefore, the giver obtains great honor,

analyzed: de'i phyir bkur sti rgya chen dang / dus dang bar chad med par rnyed //

original: longs spyod rgya chen po la dad pa rnyed par 'gyur /

original: longs spyod par chad med par rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: longs spyod par chad med par rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: One obtains wealth without obstacles.

original: 'di'i longs spyod gzhan dag gis par du mi chod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di'i longs spyod gzhan dag gis par du mi chod par 'gyur /
translated: One's wealth is not stolen by others.

original: me la sogs pas med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me la sogs pas med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not destroyed by fire, etc.

original: ji ltar na sbyin bdag khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa dang / de'i khyad par gyis sbyin pa'i khyad par yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin bdag khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa dang / de'i khyad par gyis sbyin pa'i khyad par yang bshad zin to //
translated: The excellence of the giver has been explained, and the excellence of giving by that giver.

analyzed: yang ji ltar na dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa yin zhe na /
translated: The object is superior when it is

analyzed: kha dog la sogs phun sum dngos //
translated: perfect in color, etc.üîΩThe object is superior when it is perfect in color, smell, taste, and

analyzed: de lta bu ni dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: then the object is superior.
